La actividad que desarrolla Margarita es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Complementariamente se dedica a la agricultura labor compartida con su esposo, pues tienen 2.0 ha de terreno agrícola en donde siembran cultivos transitorios; actualmente tienen sembrado maíz.
El monto solicitado  del crédito es de 3500 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado, así como la  compra de fertilizantes para su  cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 41 year-old woman, married and without children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her husband, and the house is located in the Cruce de Vega neighborhood of the District of Tambogrande.  She lives in the rural part of the district, but her area does have electricity.  

The activity that Margarita participates in is the raising of small livestock (sheep, pigs, and caged birds). When the animals gain weight and reach an exact weight she sells them in the local market.  At the same time she works in agriculture along with her husband, since they have 2.0 hectares of agricultural land where they plant rotating crops.  Currently they have planted corn.  

The loan amount requested is 3500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) and it will be used for purchasing balanced nutrition for the livestock, as well as for the purchase of fertilizers for the raising of corn.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Via

texts.en: Via is 52 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for two years. Via has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, onions and tomato sauce. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Via will help her kids and improve their home.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausage, soy sauce, garlic, onions and tomato sauce

loans.name: Adilyakhon

texts.ru: Адиляхон жительница района Джиликул. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Адиляхон при доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Adilyakhon is a resident of the Jililkul region. She is 44 years old, married and has two children. Adilyakhon has a plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables. She has been in this business for 25 years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: Maria Azucena, es una mujer con metas a futuro, puesto que su mayor anhelo es llegar a concluir la construccion de su vivienda. Azucena ya hace 4 años aproximadamente que se dedica a la venta de productos omnilife, lacteos. Junto con su esposo han podido lograr objetivos que se han forjado. Agradece a la micro-financiera que una vez mas le ha concedido ser sujeta de un credito, mismo que le permitira la construccion del muro perimetral lado este de su vivienda. Con el que obtendra seguridad y a su vez privacidad para los suyos. Para llevar a cabo el proyecto planeado en esta ocasión requerira comprar: piedras, hierro, estribos, bloques, alambre de amarre, piedrin, cemento, arena entre otros. Siendo para ella esta nueva oportunidad de credito un logro mas y asi ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones. Sus propositos a largo plazo es seguir haciendole mejoras a su hogar e instalar servicios higienicos que es de vital importancia para la salud de los que le rodean.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena is a woman with future goals and her greatest desire is to finish building her home. Approximately four years ago, Azucena started selling Omnilife and dairy products. She and her husband together have been able to achieve the goals they set for themselves. Thanks to micro-financing, she can  once again apply for a loan, this time to construct a perimeter wall on the eastern side of her house. The wall will provide security as well as privacy for her family. 

On this occasion, in order to carry out this project,  Azucdena will need to buy stone, iron, braces, blocks, wire, gravel, cement and sand among other items. This new opportunity to obtain credit is a further accomplishment for her since she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions. Her long term goals are to continue making improvements to her home and to install hygienic services which are of vital importance for the health of those living with her.

loans.use: to construct a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Anna has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, a rake, bush knives and a wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Anna hopes to improve her home and help with her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a rake, bush knives and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru:
Венере 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Венера с 2002 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS), которая была использована для покупки дойной коровы. В хозяйстве Венеры на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь и 20 овец, а  также - 2,0 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дойной коровы.  Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Venera is 37 years old, she is married and raising four children. Venera is engaged in animal husbandry and field crop cultivation since 2000 as an additional source income for her family, a business which she started with the capital of 20,000 som (KGS) which was used to buy a milk cow. Today Venera's livestock includes two cows, one calf, one horse and twenty sheep as well as 2,0 hectares of arable land where she grows potatoes and beans.

With the goal to further grow her business Venera has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy a milk cow. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Назар проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него 7 детей. Его дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он сам занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 13 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Nazar lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 49 years old, married and has seven children. His children are now working in the Russian Federation. He does animal husbandry and has been in this business for thirteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Luna  esta conformado  por diez  mujeres trabajadoras  y humildes con deseos e ilusiones de hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más.
Todas las integrantes del grupo son originarias de pinotepa nacional tierra  de gente humilde y de progreso.
Una de los bailes de pinotepa nacional son las chilenas.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Adriana Kukene de  treinta tres años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una señora amable y trabajadora.
Doña Adriana como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi desde hace cuatro años.
Ella nos dice que es maestra  de Danza  desde hace siete años, va a dar  clases en las escuelas  y también da clases particulares  a los niños.
Nos dice que esta muy contenta ya que   esta en un proyecto de  deportes donde da clases de  danza en las colonias de su comunidad.
Doña Adriana nos dice que los que más le gusta de su negocio  es enseñar a sus alumnos a bailar y que disfruten el baile.
Una  de sus metas con su negocio es que ha podido escalar ya que hasta horita da clases en los bachilleratos de su comunidad.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio son las tablas rítmicas ya que es lo que más disfruta  por que hace muchas  pirámides.
Algunos retos que la enfrenta para  nos seguir con su negocio es que en acciones no la contratan y eso la hace sentir triste.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refacciones para su taxi y así poder seguir dando servicios.
También con el crédito desea adquirir otro bien ya que desea vender ropa para niño, niña, dama y caballero.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Maria Elizabeth- quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Iris Flor- se dedica a la venta de  perfumes.
Maria Guadalupe Monica -se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Emit- se dedica a la venta de artículos de  piel.
Jazmín Lucero- se dedica a la venta de papelería.
Fadia Olivia- se dedica a la  venta de mercería.
Rosa Erica- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Silvia- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Ana- se dedica a la venta de dulces.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por apoyarlas para que su  puedan seguir con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Luna communal bank is comprised of ten hard-working and humble women.  They have hopes and dreams of making their businesses grow more each day.  All of the members of the group are from Pinotepa Nacional, land of humble people and advancement.  One of the dances from Pinotepa Nacional is the chilenas.

Adriana Kukene, age 33, is one of the members.  She is known for being a kind and hard-working woman.  Adriana, as she is better known among her group of colleagues, has been providing taxi service for four years.

She tells us that she has been a dance teacher for seven years.  She gives classes in the schools, and she also gives private lessons.  She tells us that she is very happy that she is in this recreational activity where she gives dance classes in the neighborhoods of her community.

Adriana tells us that what she likes the most about her business is teaching her students to dance and that they enjoy dancing.  One of her goals with her business was to expand.  So far she has been able to give classes in the high schools in her community.

The things she really likes about her business are the gymnastic routines set to music.  She enjoys them the most because they make a lot of human pyramids.

One of the challenges that she faces is the continuation of her business.  On the occasions when she is not hired, she feels sad.

She asked for the loan to buy more spare parts for her taxi.  This way she will be able to continue providing service.  She also wants to use the loan to get other goods because she wants to sell clothing for children and adults.

The other members of the group are:

Maria Elizabeth- sells shoes.
Iris Flor- sells perfume.
Maria Guadalupe Monica – sells sweets.
Emit- sells leather goods.
Jazmín Lucero- sells paper.
Fadia Olivia- sells notions.
Rosa Erica- sells sweets.
Silvia- sells sweets.
Ana- sells sweets.

They thank the Fundacion for supporting them so that they are able to continue with their businesses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Valeria Nataly

texts.es:
VALERIA NATALY tiene 19 años de edad es soltera tine un hijo, vive con la mamá y con el hijo de 1 año de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Valeria se dedica a la venta de productos en una bisutería cómo brasaletes, argollas, labiales, peinillas,  y a la venta de botellones de agua. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mercadería como medallones, pulseras, labiales, cosméticos.

Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hacía. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar una moto.

Los desafíos a los que se presenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir y estudiar.
texts.en:
Valeria Nataly, age 19, is single and has one child.  She lives with her mother and her one year old son in Ventanas in the Ríos province.

Valerie sells costume jewelry like bracelets and rings.  She also sells lipstick, combs, and jugs of water.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy merchandise like medallions, bracelets, lipstick, and cosmetics.  With the money from the loan she will be able to buy the merchandise that she needs so much.  She will make her purchases and her sales in Ventanas.

Her dream is to be able to buy a motorcycle.

The challenge that presents itself is the competition.  

In her free time she likes to go out and to study.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like medallions, bracelets, lipstick, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pablo Roberto

texts.es: El emprendedor Pablo Roberto tiene su negocio desde hace doce años  que es  servicio de trasporte en el traslado de arroz,  el inicio su negocio como una alternativa de de trabajo como chofer de los camiones, en la actualidad gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado pudo  cumplir su sueños de comprar su propia unidad de trasporte, el está solicitando el crédito para mejorar el piso de su casa. Necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillos, cemento, cal, clavos, arena entre otros.
texts.en: The entrepreneur Pablo Roberto has had his business for two years which is a transport service for the movement of rice. He began his business as an alternative to working as a truck driver. Currently thanks to the help of the Fundación León 2000, he has been able to fulfill his dreams of buying his own vehicle. He is asking for a loan in order to improve the floor in his home. He needs to buy supplies such as bricks, cement, lime, nails, sand, and other items.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, lime, nails, sand and other items

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos pequeños; sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos, ella vende papa deshidratada como chuño, moraya, también trigo, cebada, quinua, maíz etc. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo quien  tienen un negocio de venta de vasos y platos descartables, de forma ambulatoria, y por medio de estos negocios los esposos sacan adelante a sus hijos.
 
Francisca quiere ampliar sus negocios y solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, (Alimentos Secos) percibir mayores ingresos y poder formalizar su negocio, y poner una tienda de artículos de plástico, negocio que ellos quieren hacer crecer.

La señora Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; que está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three small children. Her daily activities include managing her business of selling dried products. She sells dehydrated potatoes, such as "chuño" and "moraya", but she also sells wheat, barley, quinoa, corn, and other products. Francisca also works with her husband, who has a business of selling disposable glasses and plates as a street vendor. Through these businesses, Francisca and her husband are able to help their children get ahead.

She wants to expand her businesses, so she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (dried foods) so that she can generate more income and formalize her business. Francisca also plans to open a plastic goods store, a business that she and her husband would like to see grow.

Sra. Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" (The Winners), which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy dried foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los mangos esta conformado por  nueve mujeres trabajadoras y alegres que se dedican diversas actividades económicas.
Todas son originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado los tres ríos o mejor conocido como la nueva esperanza  es un lugar hermosos donde hay muchos árboles y esta un rió que  se divide en tres ríos grandes.
Una de las tradiciones de la comunidad es que celebran el día de muertos ponen sus ofrendas y ya los niños van con sus canastas a pedir ofrendas.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Fortunata Teresa  de cuarenta y tres  años de edad se dedica a la  dar servicios de su molino donde muele la  nixtamal  también se dedica a la siembra de chiles desde hace siete años.
Doña Fortunata  como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo nos dice que  en las mañanas viene sus clientas a moler y en las tardes también ya que solamente  muele dos veces al día.
Lo que mas le gusta  su negocio del molino es molerles el  nixtamal a sus clientas y darles una buena atención y lo que mas le gusta de la siembra de chile es  sembrarlos  y cosecharlo.
Una de las cosas que le impiden seguir con su negocio del molino es que en ocasiones el molino no quiere moler el nixtamal  y sus clientas se desesperan ya que el molino esta un poquito  viejo.
Doña Fortunata pidió el préstamo para la compra de más líquidos  para las siembras y compra de piedras para su molino.
Doña Fortunata  esta felizmente casada con el señor  Seferino de cincuenta años de edad con quien tiene  dos hijos  Rufino y Florinda a quienes quiere mucho.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por apoyarla para que su negocio crezca cada día más  y puedan tener una mejor vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Carmela- quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Minerva- se dedica a la  venta de manualidades.
Ausencia- se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Anayeli – se dedica a la venta de antojitos.
Alejandrina Paula - se dedica a la venta de queso.
Mónica- se dedica a brindar  servicios de estilista.
Liliana – se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Romana- se dedica a la venta de pan.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarle a que su vida mejore y así puedan darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Mangos Group is comprised of nine happy, hard-working women who are engaged in various business activities.  They are all from a small town called “Los Tres Ríos” (The Three Rivers) or better known as the “La Nueva Esperanza” (The New Hope).  It is a beautiful place where there are many trees and a main river that is divided into three large rivers. The community celebrates El Día de Muertos” (The Day of the Dead), a tradition where people honor the dead with offerings and the children go out with their baskets asking for offerings.

One of the members of this group is Señora Fortunata Teresa.  She is 43 years old. She provides the services of her mill, where she grinds corn.  She has also been growing chili peppers for the past seven years.  Doña Fortunata, as she is better known by her companions in the group, tells us that her customers come to grind corn in the mornings and the evenings because she only grinds twice a day.  

What she likes most about her mill business is grinding the corn for her customers and giving them good service, and what she likes most about growing the chili peppers is planting and harvesting.  One of the things that prevent her from continuing her mill business is that sometimes the mill doesn’t want to grind the corn and her customers despair because the mill is a little old.

Doña Fortunata is requesting the loan to purchase more liquid fertilizer for planting and to purchase stones for her mill.  She is happily married to Señor Seferino who is 50 years old.  They have two children, Rufino and Florinda, who they love very much. She thanks the foundation for supporting her so that her business grows more each day enabling them to have a better life.

The other members of the group are as follows:
Carmela who sells chickens 
Minerva who sells handicrafts 
Ausencia who sells fruit
Anayeli who sells snacks
Alejandrina Paula who sells cheese
Mónica who provides hair styling services
Liliana who sells groceries
Romana who sells bread

They are thankful to the foundation for helping them improve their lives and so enabling them to provide their children with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase liquid fertilzer for chili pepper planting.

loans.name: Abigail Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Abigail esta conformado once integrantes mujeres trabajadoras  y humildes.
Los integrantes de este grupo trabajan en tienda llamada Gazher donde hay varios departamentos ya que hay farmacia, abarrotes, regalos, salchiconeria, plasticos, cristaleria y verdulería.
Todos trabajan  el diferentes puestos  ya que algunos  de estos integrantes trabajan en contabilidad  pero todos se quieren mucho no importa el departamento donde trabajen.
No todo son originarios de pinotepa  son de pueblos  muy pequeños pero  vinieron a  pinotepa a trabajar  para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Para ellos pinotepa es  tierra de progreso y superación ya que cuenta con fundacion Realidad  quien les esta ayudando para que su vidas mejoren.
Uno de los integrantes es el contador  Isaac Heriberto quien se encarga de la contabilidad en la  tienda Gazher  pero gracias  a fundacion tiene su  pequeño negocio se dedica a la venta de comida.
El nos dice que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  cocinar ya que  vende en las noches lo que son: tacos dorados, enchiladas, empanadas, sopes y tortas.
Este muy contento por el apoyo que le ha dado fundacion para que su vida mejore ya que su negocio le deja buenas ganancias y así puede  darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Esta felizmente casado con la señora  Yuliana  una señora amable trabajadora , ella nos dice que esta muy contenta por el apoyo que le ha dado  su esposo ya que los dos se encargan del negocio  se apoyan uno al otro para poder darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos.
El Cont. Isaac como mejor lo conocen   sus compañeras de grupo y compañeras de trabajo  nos dice que pidió el préstamo para la compra de  mas ingredientes para la elaboración de  comida como son: chiles verdees tomate.,cebolla,ajo,pollo,carne de res,maiz,queso,aceite y quesillo.
Una de sus dificultades con su negocio es que en ocasiones tiene  mucho trabajo y se le  hace tarde para  llegar a su negocio y ayudar a su esposo para preparar lo que van a vender.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo  que le ha dado para  que pueda tener su propio negocio  y poder trabajar y así generar más empleos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Minerva- quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Dulce Elia -quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Guadalupe Lucia-quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Ivett- quien se dedica a la venta de agua de garrafón.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Marcelina- quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Tomasa  Felicitas-quien se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Maria de Dolores –quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Angela Reyna- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos a que sus vidas cambien y puedan tener su propio negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias que son lo mas importante.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "Abigail," is made up of eleven members who are hardworking and humble women. 
The members of this communal bank work in a store called "Gazher."  The store has various departments, for example, pharmacy, grocery, gifts, deli, plastics, glassware, and greengrocer. 
They all work in different positions; some of the members even work in accounting.  But they all care for each other a lot, regardless of the department each works in.
Not all of them members are from Pinotepa originally.  Some are from very small towns, but they came to Pinotepa to work and for a better quality of life.
For them, Pinotepa is a land of progress and improvement.  Having Fundacion Realidad in Pinotepa is helping the women to better their lives. 
One of the members is the bookkeeper Isaac Heriberto, who takes care of Gazher's accounting.  But thanks to Fundacion Realidad, he also has a small business selling food.
He tells us that what he likes most about his business is cooking.  At night he sells crispy, fried tacos, enchiladas, empanadas, sopes and sandwiches (all local fare).
He is very happy about the support Fundacion Realidad has given him.  It has helped him to have a better life.  His business earns him a good profit, and with that profit, he can give his family a better life.
Isaac Heriberto is happily married to Señora Yuliana, a friendly and hardworking woman.  She tells us that she is very happy about the support her husband has been given.  She and her husband both take care of their food business and support one another in giving a better life to their two children.
Bookkeer Isaac, as he is known to the other members of the communal bank and to his co-workers, tells us that he requested the loan to purchase more ingredients for the food he sells, like: green chilies, tomatoes, onion, garlic, chicken, beef, cheese, oil and farmer's cheese.
One of the difficulties with the business is that sometimes Isaac has a lot of work at the store and is late getting home to help his spouse prepare the food for sale.
Isaac is grateful to the Foundation for the support they have given him, which has enabled him to have his own business, to work and to generate more work.
The other members of the group are:
Minerva- who makes her living selling perfume.
Dulce Elia -who makes her living selling perfume.
Guadalupe Lucia-who makes her living selling shoes.
Ivett- who makes her living selling large jugs of water.
Guadalupe- who makes her living selling clothing.
Marcelina- who makes her living selling grocery items.
Tomasa  Felicitas-who makes her living selling handicrafts.
Elizabeth-who makes her living selling grocery items.
Maria de Dolores –who makes her living selling grocery items.
Angela Reyna- who makes her living selling food.
They are all grateful to the Foundation for helping them to change their lives, to be able to have their own businesses and to improve their quality of life and that of their families, who are of greatest importance.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Perosi

texts.en: Perosi is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Perosi needs a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, oil and garlic onions. She plans to use her profits to improve her home and help with her children's education. Perosi has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy more flour, soy sauce, oil and garlic onions

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, con 03 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Punto 9, fundo El Gañan, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.
La actividad que realiza Juana  es la  venta de abarrotes en su domicilio como  pollo sacrificado por kilos, y otros. Además  cuenta con clientela fidelizada, .También se dedica a la venta de aves de corral. Adicionalmente clienta trabaja en la fábrica de sal  en el Distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Su Cónyuge  trabaja hace varios años como maestro panadero en Lambayeque lo que le permite tener algunos ingresos adicionales.
El monto solicitado  del crédito es de 4000 nuevos soles y  será para surtir su bodega  y  la compra de alimento balanceado  para sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana is a 36 year-old married woman with three dependent children.  She lives in her own home in the Punto 9 neighborhood of El Gañan, located about 15 minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

Juana works in the selling of groceries out of her house, selling things like sacrificed chickens by the kilo, and other ítems.  In addition, she can count on a faithful clientele.  She also works selling caged birds.  She also works in the salt factory in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz.  Her husband has worked for several years as a master baker in Lambayeque which allows them to have good additional income.  

She requests a loan of 4000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) and it will be used to supply her store and purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to supply her store and purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en: Soloi is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes and pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Soloi needs a loan to buy flour, soy sauce, garlic onions, sugar, baking powder and syrup. She plans to use her profits to buy another new oven for her bakery. Soloi has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy flour, soy sauce, garlic onions, sugar, baking powder and syrup

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 45-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She would like to start growing a plantation to earn a living. Makerita has requested a loan for a wheel barrow, a plant sprayer, chemicals, etc. 

She has been a member of SPBD for three years. Makerita will spend her profits to buy more tools used in her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a plant sprayer, chemicals, etc

loans.name: Rosalìa

texts.es:
Rosalía es una mujer  de 29 años de edad, soltera, vive en casa de sus  padres ubicada en el cario Santa Isabel del distrito de Mòrrope.
La actividad comercial a la  que se dedica Rosalía es la venta de abarrotes y cuenta con experiencia en este rubro, su bodega  funciona en su domicilio y en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, detergentes, leches, golosinas, etc. Además cuenta con clientes ya establecidos en la zona. Adicionalmente cría y vende animales.
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles, con el crédito comprará mas mercadería para surtir su negocio .atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a 29-year-old woman who is single and lives at her parents' house in El Cario Santa Isabel in the District of Mòrrope. Her business involves selling groceries and she has experience in this line of work. Rosalía's store is located in her home and the products she sells include basic necessities such as rice, sugar, detergents, milk, candy, and other items. She has established customers from the area. Rosalía also raises and sells animals.

The loan amount she is requesting is 1,000 PEN and will be used to buy more merchandise to restock her business. This will enable her to satisfy the unmet demand in this area, expand her clientele by obtaining new customers, and earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru:
Чынаре 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Чынара с 2011 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день хозяйство Чынары приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец.  Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Chynara is thirty-five years old, married and has two children. She began her business of raising animals in 2011 with a starting capital of 10,000 soms. It's currently her main source of income. Chynara's business has a monthly revenue of 5,000 soms from meat and milk product sales. 
Hoping to expand her business further, Chynara approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request of 60,000 soms she needs to buy sheep. 
Chynara plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gatasi

texts.en: Gatasi is 52 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for six years. Gatasi has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, fishing rods, hooks, and bait. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital. Gatasi will use her profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing rods, hooks, and bait

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en: Faimasasa is a 52-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a business selling a variety of goods in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Faimasasa has requested a loan to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to improve the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy laundry soap, cigarettes, snacks, lollies, tinned fish, etc. to sell,

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Чолпон с 1996 года занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Чолпон имеется 10 овец, 2 лошади и 0,9 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Cholpon is fifty-one years old, married and has four children. Since 1996, farming and animal raising have been her main source of income. She began this business with 15,000 soms; today, she owns ten sheep, two horses and 0.9 hectares of land which she uses to plant beans on. Via the sale of milk and milk products, Cholpon's able to bring in about 12,000 soms (KGS) a month. 

Hoping to expand her business, Cholpon approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for 100,000 soms that she needs in order to purchase some dairy cows. She plans to invest proceeds from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Beishekan

texts.ru:
Бейшекан 52 года, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Бейшекан с 2003 года занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний  день в хозяйстве Бейшекан имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 1,4 га орошаемой земли, где она выращивает ячмень и эспарцет. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бейшекан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян пшеницы.  Доходы от кредита Бейшекан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Beishekan is fifty-two years old, widowed, and the mother of five children. With a starting capital of 2,000 soms, Beishekan started a farming and animal raising business in 2003. Today, it's her main source of income. She currently owns two cows, one horse and 1.4 hectares of land uses to raise barley and cock's head. 
The sale of milk and milk products brings in about 4,000 soms (KGS) a month. 
Hoping to expand her business, Beishekan approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for 30,000 soms she needs in order to purchase wheat seeds. She plans to invest profits generated from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos, pero ya todos ellos son casados,a sí que ninguno de ellos está a su cargo.

Guadalupe quedo viuda desafortunadante y por lo tanto tiene que mantenerse por si misma, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos en su domicilio, en éste negocio ya tiene 12 años con su negocio. Para poder hacer mas grande su negocio y también meterle mas ingresos necesita mas mercancía, ella invertrirá su prestamo en mas productos de refrescos para la venta y espera que su prestamo le sea de gran utilidad.

Guadalupe es integrante de Las Rosas grupo ubicado en el Llano grande municipio de San Marcos, integrado por 12 mujeres muy trabajadoras que saben como salir adelante sin depender de nadie, la cual a continuación serán mencionadas: Estela, Guadalupe, Juliana,Maria Isabel, Leonarda, Celia, Luciana, José Deibi, Alfa, Celida, Froylan por lo que se dedican a la venta de: refrescos, Cenas, Abarrotes, Tamales, Ropa, Maíz, Comida, Tortillas, Artículos para cocer y Pan.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, age 52, is a widow with five children. None of them are in her care since they are all married.

Since she was unfortunate to become a widow, Guadalupe had to find a way to support herself. She sells soft drinks from her home and has been in business for 12 years. Guadalupe would like to expand her business and generate more income, but she needs more merchandise. She will invest her loan in more soft drinks to sell. Guadalupe hopes that her loan will be very useful.

Guadalupe is a member of the group "Las Rosas" (The Roses), which is located in Llano Grande, in the town of San Marcos. The group consists of 12 hardworking women who know how to succeed without have to depend on anyone. The other members are Estela, Guadalupe, Juliana, Maria Isabel, Leonarda, Celia, Luciana, José Deibi, Alfa, Celida, and Froylan. They sell various products such as soft drinks, meals, groceries, tamales, clothing, corn, food, cooking utensils, and bread.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Joselito Alexander

texts.es:
JOSELITO ALEXANDER tiene 45 años de edad tiene dos hijos es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

JOSELITO ALEXANDER se dedica al cultivo la cual arrienda para hacerlo naranja. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de naranja cacao, herbicidas, mata montes, abonos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arrendar el cultivo de naranja.
Las compras y ventas de productos las realiza en el Cantón Caluma cada semana.
Su sueño a cumplir es tener su propia casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es dar el estudio a sus hijos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte.
texts.en:
Joselito Alexander, 45, is married and has 2 children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Montalvo canton in the Los Rios province.  He is a member of the communal bank "Embarcadero Chico."  He is a farmer who cultivates cocoa, oranges, cassava, and several varieties of bananas.  He also raises animals.

Joselito Alexander rents land where he cultivates oranges.  He is requesting a loan to buy orange and cocoa plants, herbicides, brush killer and fertilizers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to rent land to cultivate oranges.  He makes his purchases and sells his products in Caluma canton each week.  

Joselito's dream is to have his own house.  The challenge he faces is to provide his children with an education.  In his free time he enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: to buy orange and cocoa plants, herbicides, brush killer and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abrahan Napoleon

texts.es:
Abraham Napoleón tiene 42 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos en el  Cantón Montalvo provincia de los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural Embarcadero Chico. se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Abraham Napoleón se dedica a la siembra de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de materiales cómo el cemento, madera, tejas para la infraestructura, tendales para poder secar el cacao.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la finca y los cultivos.
Las compras de los materiales para la infraestructura los realizaran en el Cantón Caluma y Montalvo cada semana.
Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son a las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Abraham Napoleón is 42 years old.  He is single and has two children.  He lives with his children in Montalvo Canton, de los Ríos Province.  He belongs to the communal bank "Embarcadero Chico" (Small Pier).  The members make their livings growing cacao, oranges, bananas, yucca and plantains and raising animals.
Abraham Napoleón makes his living planting cacao, oranges, bananas, finger bananas, yucca and plantain and raising animals.
He is requesting the loan to be able to purchase some materials, like cement, wood and brickwork, for infrastructure and lines for drying the cacao.
With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve the farm and his crops.
He will purchase the infrastructure materials Caluma Canton and Montalvo each week.
Abraham Napoleón's dream is to be able to purchase a vehicle.
The challenges he faces are crop pests and disease.
In his free time, Abraham Napoleón likes to do sports.

loans.use: to be able to purchase materials, like cement, wood and brickwork, for infrastructure and lines for drying the cacao.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25-year-old man. He is married to Mary and they have three children, aged 5, 3, and 1 year.

Daniel is a farmer and has been producing maize for the last five years. He makes a monthly income of Kes 5,000. He is now taking his second KADET LTD loan, which he will use to purchase farm inputs and labour costs. He plans to use the profits to repay the loan and also grow his farm.

His dream is to work extra hard so as to earn enough income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and labour costs.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es un hombre de 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales  están en su poder, reside junto a su esposa en la parte rural de olmos es un caserío pequeño, los esposos tienen buenas referencias son conocidos y responsables.
Mariano se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros  con una experiencia de mas de 3 años en el caserío de callejón de cascajal  y alrededores , el monto otordado del crèdito es de 2000 nuevos soles y va ser destinado para el mantenimiento de la mototaxi  y compra de insumos para su cultivo de limón  , ya que esto le permitirá tener mas eficiencia en el transporte de pasajeros y se mejoraran su condiciones de vida ya que la demanda por limón se ha incrementado y por lo tanto sus ingresos aumentaran, su meta es comprar una moto carguera para que sea mas eficiente en el traslado del limón hacia la playa cascajal donde vende el limón.
texts.en:
Mariano is a 38 year old man.  He lives with his partner and has 2 dependent children.  He lives with his wife in the rural part of Olmos, a small rural community.  Mariano and his wife have good references, are well-known and are responsible. 
Mariano makes his living offering a transportation service for passengers.  He has more than 3 years experience in the streets of the Cascajal community and its environs.  The granted loan amount of 2000 nuevos soles (USD $775) will be used for maintainance on his mototaxi (motor bike taxi) and to purchase supplies for his lemon crop.  Maintaining his mototaxi will allow him to be more efficient in transporting his passengers.  Investing in his lemon crop will improve his quality of life, as the lemon demand has increased, and his earnings will as well.  Mariano's goal is to purchase a "moto carguera" (cargo motorbike) to be able to move his lemons more efficiently to the Cascajal beach, where he sells his lemons.

loans.use: to keep up his mototaxi (motorbike taxi) and to purchase supplies for his lemon crop.

loans.name: Zwarouski Group

texts.es: La señora Silvia va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos de dama, caballero y niños, la señora Verónica va a comprar verdura, carne,, refrescos y ropa, la señora Raquel va a comprar tintes, uñas, acrílicos, pinceles, pinturas, decoraciones, etc.  La señora Virginia Guadalupe va a comprar azúcar, huevo, sal, sopas, jabón, aceite, refrescos. La señora Virginia tiene 37 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de autopartes de autos, ella tiene una tienda de perfumes, regalos y abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar aceite, azúcar, leche, jabón, huevo, chiles secos guajillo, refresco, aguas, chiles en vinagre, atún, sardinas, crema nívea, shapoo, regalos, juguetes, monederos, carteras, tines, calcetas, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años, es herencia de su mama y ahora es familiar la atiende su esposo y su hija, su negocio es importante porque le ayuda en la economía, ella se siente orgullosa de vender perfumes y cosméticos de Avon por los regalos que le llegan, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprarles algo a sus papas como frutas, el gas o medicinas. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más cosas para regalo como ropa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son crecer su negocio meter más de todo y que su hija tenga una mejor educación, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir por la oportunidad de surtir su tienda. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan para hacer crecer nuestros negocios, gracias por los préstamos que nos dan y que sigan ayudando a las personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en: With this loan, Silvia is going to buy shoes for men, women and children.  Veronica will buy vegetables, meat, drinks and clothing.  Raquel will buy hair color, acrylic nails, brushes, nail polish, accessories, etc.  Virginia Guadalupe will buy sugar, eggs, salt, soups, soap, cooking oil and drinks.  Virginia is 37 years old.  She is married and her husband works in a factory that makes automobile parts.  She has a store where she sells perfumes, gifts and groceries.  She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, eggs, dried guajillo chili peppers, drinks, water, pickled peppers, olives, sardines, Nivea cream, shampoo, gifts, toys, change purses, wallets, socks, etc.  She started in her business 15 years ago; she inherited it from her mother.  Now it is a family business that her husband and daughter also participate in.  Her business is important because it helps her with her finances.  She feels proud to sell perfumes and Avon cosmetics because of the gifts that she gets.  She will use the proceeds to buy something for her parents, such as fruit, gas or medicines.  She is planning to expand her business by purchasing more gift items, such as clothing.  Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business by having more of everything, and also to provide her daughter with a better education.  She is happy with the loan that she is going to receive, which will give her the opportunity to stock up her store.  The members of this group want to say to Kiva and to the Fundación Realidad, "We appreciate the opportunity that you are giving us to make our businesses grow.  Thank you for the loans that you are providing us, and keep helping those in need."

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, eggs, dried guajillo chili peppers, drinks, water, pickled peppers, olives, sardines, Nivea cream, shampoo, gifts, toys, change purses, wallets, socks, etc.

loans.name: Las Fresas Group

texts.es:
Eusebia cuenta con 50 años de edad, es casada su esposo se llama Crecencino es maestro, tienen 3 hijos el mayor  estudia una licenciatura se llama Víctor y tiene 27 años de edad el otro se llama Gerino tiene 23 años y el más chico tiene 20 se llama Crecencio.

Eusebia es comerciante y  se dedica a la venta de pollos tiene 2 años en el negocio, invertirá su préstamo en la ampliación del negocio para poder tener más ganancias como comerciante y poder ayudarle más en la educación de sus hijos, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanza y ella como la cabeza de la familia tener que mantenerla. Su meta es hacer más grande su negocio para mayores ingresos.
Eusebia pertenece al grupo de las Fresas lo cual tiene el total de 2 integrantes que a continuación se mencionaran: Félix, Aideth, Hilaria, María de la Luz, Eusebia, Consuelo, Lucia, Reyna, Bertina, Ermanda, Isabel y Dionicia quienes se dedican a la venta de pan bolillos,el tranposte, venta de queso y pescado, verduras y pollos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 50 years old.  She is married.  Her husband, Crecencino, is a teacher.  They have 3 children.  The oldest, Victor, is 27 and earning a bachelor's degree.  Gerino is 23 years old, and the youngest, Crecencio, is 20 years old.

Eusebia is a sales woman and makes her living selling chickens.  She has been in the business for 2 years.  She will invest the loan in expanding her business so she can earn a greater profit as a sales woman and help with her children's education.  Her husband's salary is not sufficient, and Eusebia, as the head of the family, needs to support the family.  Her goal is to grow her business in order to have a better income.
Eusebia belongs to the communal bank "Las Fresas" (The Strawberries), which has a total of 12 members.  They are mentioned here: Félix, Aideth, Hilaria, María de la Luz, Eusebia, Consuelo, Lucia, Reyna, Bertina, Ermanda, Isabel and Dionicia.  They make their livings selling rolls, in transportation, and selling cheese, fish, vegetables and chickens.

loans.use: to sell chickens.

loans.name: Angel Edilberto

texts.es:
ANGEL EDILBERTO tiene 73 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos es casado vive con su esposa en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

ANGEL EDILBERTO se dedica a la cría de animales como ganado y cerdos.
Solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, pollos, ternera y poderlos comercializar.

Con la ayuda del crédito podre comprar los animales para criarlos y venderlos.

Las compras y ventas de animales los realiza con frecuencia en el Cantón Caluma cada semana.

El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para uso exclusivo y comodidad para el y su familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es a la insuficiencia del factor económico.

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su familia.
texts.en:
Angel Edilberto is 73 years old and has four children. He is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Montalvo in Los Ríos Province. Angel is a member of the Communal Bank "Embarcadero Chico". The members engage in the cultivation of cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, cassava, plantains, and the breeding of animals.

Angel Edilberto raises animals, such as cattle and pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs, chickens, and steers that he can sell. With the help of this loan, he will buy animals to raise and sell. The purchase and sale of animals occurs frequently in the canton of Caluma each week. His dream is to buy a vehicle for the exclusive use and comfort of himself and his family. The challenges he faces include insufficient finances.

In his free time, Angel Edilberto enjoys spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, and steers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 53-year-old widow with six children. With one child currently going to school, Alicia works very hard to provide for all her children. Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.
Alicia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, eggs, noodles, soap, and soft drinks.
In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Jasmine has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal and gasoline.

Jasmine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He sells clothes in Malindi for a living and has been in the business for the last three years. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of 22,000 KES. He intends to use the loan to add men's shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts and so on for his business.

He will save the anticipated profits and help take care of his family as well as pay school fees for his children. In the future, Johnstone hopes to grow his business as he intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: to add men's shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts and so on for his business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is married with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children, who are in school.

Daisy has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Daisy has been in this business for one year. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Mesias Delfin

texts.es:
Mesías Delfín tiene 30 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón  Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

Mesías Delfín se dedica al cultivo de cacao y orito.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, urea y fertilizantes.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá cultivar mas cacao y tener mayores ingresos.
Las compra y la venta de los insumos las realiza en el Cantón Caluma cada semana. El sueño es incrementar el cultivo de cacao y obtener una mejor cosecha para tener mayores ingresos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la escasez de dinero para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte, jugar indor.
texts.en:
Mesías Delfín is 30 years old, is single and has two sons. He lives with his children in the Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. He belongs to the communal bank “Embarcadero Chico”, they make a living growing cocoa, oranges, green bananas, baby bananas, cassava, bananas and breeding animals.

Mesías Delfín makes a living growing cocoa and baby bananas. He requests a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, urea and fertilizer.

With the help of the loan, he may increase the cocoa output and have higher incomes. He does the purchases and sales of the agricultural inputs in Canton Caluma each week. The dream is to increase the cultivation of cocoa and get a better harvest to have higher incomes.

The challenges that he faces is the shortage of money to cover the household expenses.

In the free time, he likes to sport, play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as manure, urea and fertilizer

loans.name: Marina Esther

texts.es: María Ester tiene 44 años de edad, su actividad  económica  a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, esta actividad económica  a la que se dedica la realiza de forma ambulante, ella visita a los clientes a los cuales les ofrece su producto. Ella tiene tres hijos que el mayor trabaja y la apoya en los gastos del hogar los otros dos están estudiando  y la ayudan en  el negocio por que también se llevan productos a la universidad productos para ofrecerle a sus compañeros. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María Esther is 44 years old; the economic activity she carries out is selling general merchandise.  She does this from place to place visiting customers and bringing them the products she sells.  

She has three children.  The oldest works and helps her with household expenses and the other two are students and help her with the business since they also take products to the university to offer their classmates.  

This entrepreneur is asking for financing to buy products like pants, shirts, skirts and a variety of cosmetics among other things.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and other items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a machine shop business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase other equipment for her shop.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase other equipment for her machine shop

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 39 years old and married with 3 children.  With one kid in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feed, soft drinks, sugar, cigarettes, soap, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 23 years old and is single. He owns a barber shop business and he has been in this business for one year. His business is open from 7 am to 9 pm every day except Sunday and he currently employs three people to help him. 

Eric has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more machines, uniforms, chairs, etc. for his barber shop. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more machines, uniforms, chairs, etc. for his barber shop.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La Sra. Timotea ahora tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno para engorde y posterior venta, la socia cría las vacas las hace engordar y luego los lleva a lugares como Combata para poder venderlos, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de vacas. 

Timotea solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para su ganado, ella está segura que continuando con esta actividad podrá crecer económicamente y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Timotea pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Sra. Timotea now is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling cattle to fatten for eventual resale. Timotea raises cows for fattening and then takes them to places, such as Combata, to sell. Through this business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Timotea wants to expand her business of selling cows, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for the animals. She is confident of continuing her business so that she can grow financially and improve her family's quality of life.

Timotea is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" (The Winners), which is located in the District of Andahuaylillas, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es: Nuris una joven de apenas 28 años de edad continua dedicandose al comercio desde hace varios años. Luego de estar laborando en el extranjero manifiesta que en su negocio le ha ido muy bien. Pues ha sido este mismo el sosten para ella poderles dar lo mejor a sus dos pequeñas quienes se encuentran en periodos de escolaridad primaria. Ella continua con su pulperia, que incio con ahorros propios pero que en un tiempo la fue fortaleciendo mediante micro-creditos. Dentro de sus necesidades mas apremiantes esta la re-inversion que en esta ocasión y con este nuevo financiamiento le hara a su negocio, comprando con el prestamo 6 Quintales de arroz, 6 quintales de azucar 4 bidones de aceite 4 quintales de frijol, 10 cajas de gaseosa, productos de aseo personal, productos de aseo para el hogar entre otros. Sus proyectos en un futuro esta el mejorar su vivienda y brindarle a su familia mejores comodidades y aun mas un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Nuris, 28, continues with the work she has been doing for several years. After working abroad it's clear that her business is going very well because it has allowed her to provide her kids, who are in elementary school, with the very best. She still works at her corner store, which she started with her own savings but over time has strengthened with small loans. Of all the things she needs, the most pressing is this latest investment that she will make with the loan, buying 600lbs of rice, 600lbs of sugar, 4 oil drums, 400lbs of beans, 10 cases of sodas, personal hygiene and household cleaning products. Her future projects will include improving her home and giving her family more comforts and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products for her corner store.

loans.name: Hansel

texts.es:
Hansel  es un hombre  de 27 años de edad,  es Conviviente y con 01 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres con su conviviente y su hijo. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío La Pala Distrito de  Tambogrande, y no cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 150 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Hansel  es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino y porcino, caprinos), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente es trabajador estable en un fundo agrícola en donde además es cuidador y vive en dicho predio y le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado  del crédito es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y la compra de calaminas para el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hansel is a 27 year old man; he has a spouse and a son in his care.  He lives with his spouse and son in his parents’ house.  The house is located in Caserío La Pala, Tambogrande District; it does not have electricity.  The place is a small community of approximately 150 families.

The activity Hansel carries out is raising small livestock (sheep, pigs and goats) to sell.  When they reach ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.  He’s been in this business for about 6 years and the business is located at home.  He learned this occupation from his parents, that is to say he knows the line of work to perfection.  In addition, he’s also a regular employee on a large agricultural estate where he also works as a caretaker living on the premises thus earning additional income.

The amount of the requested loan is 3000 new soles that he will use to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his livestock and to buy sheets of plywood for the roof on his house.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and also plywood for his house.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi is 44 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jane, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been a dairy farmer and a mixed crop farmer as his primary business and he has owned and managed a primary school for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mwangi will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer, and use the rest to buy school furniture and renovate the classrooms. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will buy animal feed. His hopes and dreams are to develop his school, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and use the rest to buy school furniture and renovate the classrooms.

loans.name: Auxiliadora Delcarmen

texts.es: La  señora Auxiliadora de oficio comerciante es originaria de León se dedica a la venta de comida, de 40 años de edad, casada, madre de un hijo. Auxiliadora Inicio su actividad desde hace 10 años vendiendo comida solo los fines de semana pero aumento su clientela   y a petición de ellos empezó a cocinar por mas días seguidos pues a los clientes le gusta la rica comida que elabora Auxiliadora,  en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su hermana y esposo, sus productos los comercializa en su barrio y en las comunidades mas cercana. Cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes del esposo que aporta con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene como expectativa seguir  siempre en su negocio. Solicita el préstamo para compa de productos tales como plátanos, repollo, carne, queso, cebolla, chiltoma, todo  lo necesario para la elaboración de su comida y poder satisfacer a sus clientes el cual le ayudara ya que podrá comprar toda la materia prima para su negocio, sus planes  futuros es mantener su negocio para tener mas ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Auxiliadora works as a merchant and is originally from Leon, Nicaragua. She makes a living selling food. She is 40 years old, married and has a son. She started her business 10 years ago selling food only on the weekends, but her clientele grew and at their request she started cooking more days so her customers could enjoy the rich food she prepares. Her sister and husband help her with the business, and she sells her products in her neighborhood and in the nearby communities. Her husband also contributes to the household income. Auxiliadora wants to continue with her business forever. She is requesting the loan to purchase products like bananas, cabbage, meat, cheese, onion and sweet peppers, all of which she needs to make her meals so she can satisfy her customers and purchase all the raw materials she needs for her business. Her plans for the future are to stay with the business so she can have more income and make headway for her family.

loans.use: to purchase products like bananas, cabbage, meat, cheese, onion and sweet peppers.

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
Arcoiris es un grupo conformado por ocho mujeres trabajadoras. Su nombre lo atribuyen a que cada una aporta un color de compromiso al grupo para que este funcione bajo el esquema de crédito solidario.
Maria Teresa, una de sus integrantes, es madre de dos hijos. Ella sabia que de alguna manera podía trabajar, sin descuidar sus responsabilidades de madre y brindar la educación y cuidado a sus hijos. Deseaba aportar un ingreso al hogar, comenzó a aprender con amistades el arte de la belleza y  decidió poner una estética en su casa. Sin mucha publicidad, mas que las recomendaciones de sus clientes, es como ha ido creciendo su negocio. 
Ella esta convencida en que va por la ruta correcta.
texts.en:
Arcoiris [Rainbow] is a group made up of 8 hardworking women. They came up with their name because each one contributes a color of commitment to the group so that it works under the system of joint credit. 

One of the members, Maria Teresa, is a mother of two. She knew that she had to work in some way without neglecting her responsibilities as a mother to care for her and educate her kids. She wanted to bring in some income, and with some friends began learning the art of beauty and decided to put a salon in her home. She has grown her business mostly by recommendations from her customers, without much advertising. She's convinced that she's on the right path.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products.

loans.name: Dionicio Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Dionicio caballero trabajador. Continua con su oficio de cadete de taxi, pues ha sido su medio de trabajo para ayudar a sus hijos. Su señora esposa quien es comerciante considera importante apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que dia a dia crecen los costos de canasta basica y aun mas las obligaciones de cubrir con los pagos de los servicios necesarios que se usan a diario en el hogar.Siendo para Dionicio uno de sus principal objetivo el llevar a cabo la construccion del muro y levantar nivel de casa, reccurre una vez mas a la micro-financiera para gozar de este quinto ciclo de credito, con el cual obtendra mayor seguridad para el y su familia. Ya que debido a que en temporadas no le es tan rentable su negocio de taxi por lo que el no ha podido llegar a la meta la cual ha sido de una vez por todas dar finalizada la construccion de su vivienda. Con el prestamo comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: Hierro, arena, bloques, cemento, piedrin, alambre de amarre, perlines, golosos entre otros y asi empezar la obra.
texts.en: Dionicio is a hard-working man. He continues to work as a taxi driver since that has been his means of supporting his children. His wife, who is a merchant, considers it important to support her husband with the household expenses since those are growing by the day and they have more obligations to pay for the basic services they use. One of Dionicio's main objectives is to start construction on a wall and raise the level of his home. He turns once again for a microloan to enjoy a fifth credit cycle, which he will use to provide more security for himself and his family. Because of the season his taxi business isn't as lucrative, which is why he hasn't achieved his goal of finish building his home once and for all. With the loan, he plans to purchase the following materials: iron, sand, bricks, cement, gravel, wire, beams and other items and thus begin the work.

loans.use: to build a wall and raise the level of his home.

loans.name: Gerarda De La Asuncion

texts.es: Gerarda tiene 49 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de hamacas y una pulpería, Gerarda fue ayudante de su mama cuando este trabajo elaborando hamacas, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado realizar los financiamientos que tiene hasta el momento, pues siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, galletas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mantener el negocio activo y así poder tener una prospera herramienta de trabajo para el beneficio económico de su familia.
texts.en: Gerarda is 49 years old.  Her economic activities are selling hammocks and running a grocery store.  Gerarda used to help her mother make hammocks when she was in this business and with the passage of time she’s managed to get the loans she’s had to date because she’s always liked her work.  Now, she’s asking for financing to buy snacks, soft-drinks, bread, juice and cookies, among other things.  She dreams with keeping the business active to have a prosperous work tool for her family’s economic benefit.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft-drinks, bread, juice and cookies, among other things.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Kattia es una señora de 37 años de edad, vive en  una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. Esta es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades.

Kattia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía nacional. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Ella vende su producto a turistas y negocios comerciales. Actualmente requiere un préstamo de ¢250.000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para comprar materiales como madera, pinturas, pinceles y otros, para poder continuar con la producción .Con esta actividad ella colabora con los gastos básicos de la familia y los suyos propios, su deseo es llegar a hacer grande su empresa y aumentar su clientela.

Kattia es  socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Kattia is a 37-year-old woman.  She lives in a rural community in Costa Rica called San Cristóbal Norte, located 45 kilometers south of San José.  It is a slightly mountainous area where people work in business; growing vegetables, coffee, and other things; arts and crafts; livestock; and many other activities.

Kattia works making national arts and crafts.  Her micro-enterprise has helped improve considerably her family's living conditions.  She sells her products to tourists and commercial businesses.  With this job she helps with her family's basic expenses and her own.  Her desire is to make her business big and increase her clientele.

Currently she needs a loan for 250,000 (two hundred fifty thousand) colones [CRC] to buy materials such as wood, paint, paintbrushes, and others, to be able to continue with her production.

Kattia is a member of the San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) communal bank, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to make national arts and crafts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una señora de 40 años de edad, vive en  una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Elizabeth  con su familia.

Desde hace diez años trabaja confeccionando ropa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base del éxito del negocio.

Ella ha tenido tres créditos anteriormente a tráves de su grupo comunal, llamado SACRIN. Actualmente requiere un préstamo de ¢700.000 (setecientos mil colones) para comprar materiales de construcción para ampliar su taller de costura, comprar una mesa más grande para corte de telas y pagar mano de obra.
Elizabeth es  socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 40 year old woman.  She lives in a rural community in Costa Rica located 45 kilometers south of San José called San Cristóbal Norte.  San Cristóbal is a somewhat mountainous zone where activities like commerce, growing vegetables, coffee and others, animal husbandry and many other activities take place.

Elizabeth and her family has worked making clothes for the last ten years.  Her micro business has helped her in that her family’s living conditions have improved considerably.  She says that being able to provide good service to people and meet their expectations are the basis of her business’ success.

She has had three previous loans through her communal group, called SACRIN.  She currently needs a ¢700.000 (seven-hundred thousand) colones loan to buy building materials and supplies to expand her workshop, to buy a larger table to cut fabric and to pay labor costs.

Elizabeth is a member of the “San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) communal bank one of EDESA’s 110 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy building materials, a cutting table and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Silvia Melania

texts.es: Silvia Melania comenzó su negocio hace unos 7 Años, vendiendo cosméticos y perfumería en general, luego empezó a laborar en una zona franca y ahí vendía sus productos y se extendió con ropa, y calzados, ahora tiene una mayor clientela ya que sus compañeras de trabajo son la mayoría de sus cliente,  gracias al financiamiento de fundación león 2000 ha podido obtener una herramienta de trabaja para poder mantener  a sus  dos hijos menores de edad y que junto a su esposo le enseñan a salir adelante para que su medio de vida mejore cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa, perfumes, sabanas, cremas, toallas, bolsos y calzado.
texts.en:
Silvia Melania set up her business seven years ago, selling cosmetics and perfumes. She then started working in a free trade zone and sold her products there. She extended her business, selling clothes and footwear, and now has a larger customer base as her work colleagues make up most of her customers.

Thanks to the financing of Fundación Leon 2000, she has been able to obtain a tool to make a living for the support of her two dependent children and, together with her husband, they are teaching them to get ahead and improve their life day to day. Silvia needs this loan to buy clothes, perfume, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga   es un mujer   de 37 años de edad,  es casada y con 04 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío San Pedro San Pablo Km. 26 del distrito de Sullana y cuenta con servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña de aproximadamente 250 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Olga  es la crianza y venta  de ganado menor (ovino, caprinos, porcino, caprinos y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso exacto los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años aproximadamente, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio y aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Complementariamente su cónyuge es agricultor y tiene 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola  en el cual tiene sembrado limón y cosecha semanalmente y le permite tener ingresos adicionales.
El monto del crédito solicitado   es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en la  compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado menor y la compra de calaminas para el techo de su corral, está inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Olga is a 37 year old woman, married and has 4 children under her care. She lives in her own home. It is located in the San Pedro San Pablo Hamlet about 26 Km. from the Sullana district. She has electricity and the area is a small neighborhood of about 250 families.

Olga works raising and selling small livestock (sheep, goats, pigs, and chickens), that when they reach a certain size and weight are sold in her local market. She has worked in this field for about 8 years, Olga works in her home and learned her trade from her parents and she has learned it to perfection.

Her partner is in agriculture and has 1 hectare of farmland where he grows lemons that are harvested weekly and allows them to have extra income.

The amount of the loan is 2000 nuevos soles, they will be used to buy nutritious feed for her small livestock and calamine for the roof of her farmyard, this investment will help Olga keep her business growing.

loans.use: buy nutritious feed and fix her farmyard.
