loans.name: Las Malinches Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Anastacia y Cirina van a comprar con su prestamo aguacate, durazno, ciruela y peras. La señora Cirina tiene 31 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene 3 hijas mujeres 2 están estudiando la primaria y la otra esta pequeña, ella vende fruta de temporada, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar aguacate, durazno y peras, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años con unos ahorros que tenia,  su esposo le enseño a trabajar en la venta de fruta de temporada, ella compra las frutas en la plaza y lo revende en otras plazas, su negocio es importante porque le gusta vender fruta y tiene su propio negocio que le da ingresos para los gastos de sus hijas, su negocio es popular por la calidad, sabor y frescura de la fruta,. Este negocio le ayuda a mejorar económicamente a su familia. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener más ventas y que a sus hijas les guste trabajar y sean personas de bien. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos nos ayudan a seguir trabajando en los negocios y que nos sigan favoreciendo con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
The new members of the group are Anastacia and Cirina.  With their loan they are going to buy avocados, peaches, plums, and pears.

Cirina, 31, is married and has three daughters.  Two are studying in elementary school and the other one is little.  She sells seasonal fruit.  She requested her loan to buy avocados, peaches, and pears.

She began her business three years ago with some savings she had.  Her husband taught her to work selling seasonal fruit.  She buys the fruit in the plaza and resells it in other plazas.  Her business is important because she likes to sell fruit and she has her own business, which gives her income for her daughters' expenses.

Her business is popular for the quality, flavor, and freshness of her fruit.  This business helps her to improve her family financially.  Her dreams and hopes are to have more sales and for her daughters to like to work and to be good people.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you very much for your loans.  They help us to keep on working in our businesses.  Continue supporting us with your loans."

loans.use: to buy avocados, peaches, plums, and pears.

loans.name: Albernus

texts.en:
Albernus is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. For the past three years, he has earned a living by making and selling wooden crafts in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20000.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his first loan for KES 30000 to buy timber to be used to make the wooden crafts he sells to his customers. 
He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his children's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy timber to be used to make the wooden crafts he sells to his customers

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva has run an agricultural business in Getahovit village, Tavush region about 17 years. She breeds cows and pigs, grows fruits and vegetables, and runs a bee-keeping operation. Her business produces milk, cheese and butter, as well as fruits and vegetables. This provides for her family but volume from these agricultural products is small. Silva also sells piglets and produces honey which allows her to meet most of her family’s needs. With income from her occupation Silva was able to buy furniture for her house, pay for her children’s education, and pay for her younger son’s wedding.
Silva is married and she has two sons. Silva’s husband works as a forester and helps his wife in her agricultural business. Silva’s sons and her younger son’s family also live with Silva and they also help her with farming.
Silva needs an 800.000 Armenian dram loan to buy three calves and to construct five new beehives. The calves will allow Silva to produce dairy products for future sales. Silva and her husband will displace young bees in the five new beehives to increase their bee families in the near future.

loans.use: to buy three calves and to construct five new beehives.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen Elena es una señora que vive en la zona Sur del país, especificamente, en la provincia de Puntarenas,  cantón de Golfito, distrito de Guaycara, esta es una zona caracterizada por tener un bajo desarrollo humano, y con pocas oportunidades de empleo remunerado para mujeres de alli que las mujeres se ven en la necesidad de autoemplearse, lo que logran mediante la venta de diferentes articulos de catálogo, tales como ropa interior, cosmeticos, bolsos, bisuteria ete, utilizando el sistema de ventas a crédito, este préstamo reforzara su capital de trabajo y se destinara a la compra de las mismas mercancias que ella comercializa así como otros que su clientela demanda; ya que cuenta con un mercado donde puede vender sus productos.
Una de las metas que tiene Carmen Elena, es hacer algunas mejoras a su vivienda, ya que la misma es una casa de habitación, otorgada por el estado Costarricense, pero que se entrega con lo minimo, con la idea de que sean los mismos adjudicatarios los que poco a poco le realizen las mejoras; con este programa de gobierno se benefician muchas personas de escasos recursos, que de otra forma no podrían accesar a una vivienda digna.
texts.en: Carmen Elena lives in southern Costa Rica, specifically in the province of Puntarenas, town of Golfito, district of Guaycara. This area is known for a low standard of living with few employment opportunities for women, who take matters into their own hands by working for themselves. Many sell different items via catalog, such as undergarments, cosmetics, handbags, jewelry, etc., using a system of selling on credit. This loan will replenish Carmen's working capital, and she plans to use it to buy the same things that she sells to her customers and that they continue to demand, so she already has a market for products. One of her goals is to make some improvements to her home, which is provided by the Costa Rican government but has minimal amenities. Many people of limited resources who would otherwise not have access to a dignified home benefit greatly from this program.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, undergarments and handbags via catalog.

loans.name: Alcides Hernan

texts.es:
Alcides Hernán tiene 32 años de edad es soltero vive con sus familiares en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural de Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Alcides Hernán se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentación para los pollos, cerdos cómo el balanceado polbillo, vacunas, vitaminas para poder venderlos.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar animales como cerdos. 
Las compras y las ventas  de los productos y animales los realiza en el Cantón Caluma cada semana.
Su sueño es hacer su casa para vivir en mejores condiciones. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el factor climático, exceso de lluvias.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Alcides Hernán is 32 years old, single, and lives with his relatives in the canton of Montalvo in Los Ríos Province. Alcides is a member of the Communal Bank "Embarcadero Chico". The members engage in the cultivation of cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, cassava, plantains, and the breeding of animals.

Alcides Hernán grows cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, plantains, and raises animals. He is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for his chickens and pigs, such as balanced powders, vaccines, and vitamins so that the animals can be sold. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy animals such as pigs. The purchase and sale of his products and animals take place in the canton of Caluma each week. His dream is to build a house where he can live in better conditions. The challenges he faces include weather factors, such as excessive rain.

In his free time, Alcides enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Marìa Francisca

texts.es:
María es una mujer de  25 años de edad  de  estado civil soltera, domiciliada  en el caserío la Piedra Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumi.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica María  es la venta de combustible y crianza de animales, además  cuenta con  04 años de experiencia  y adicionalmente  realiza recargas telefónicas, el negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio.
El monto solicitado  del crédito es de 2000 nuevos soles y  será para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales, actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente  a la venta de  combustible.
texts.en:
María is a 25 year old single woman and a resident of the small neighborhood of La Piedra Punto Cuatro in the district of Mochumi. María’s business is selling fuel and raising livestock; she has 4 years of experience. Additionally, she sells cards to reload minutes for cellular phones. She runs this business from her home. 
	The requested loan amount is 2000 nuevos soles (PEN), and it will be used for the purchase of balanced feed for her animals. At the moment, she also plans to expand her inventory for her fuel sales.

loans.use: to purchase more balanced feed and for the sale of fuel.

loans.name: Olga Narcisa

texts.es: Olga es una joven emprendedora de 18 años que vive en Puerto Limón, una linda parroquia en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, Ecuador. Se caracteriza el lugar por estar llena de una extensa vegetación que inunda a de bellos paisajes a las tierras comunales de la comunidad Tsáchila que habita en la región. Por ser de un clima cálido se pueden ver los cultivos de limón, papaya, tomate, café y aguacate para el uso  y comercio de la comunidad. Olga tiene ahora una pequeña tienda de barrio en este lugar, trabaja 6 horas diarias. Su madre le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe y desea poder tener una inversión para que a través de mercadería pueda incrementar sus ventas. Las metas que tiene Olga a corto plazo son poder pagar sus estudios y continuar su educación, además de poder adquirir un vehículo para poder movilizarse más fácilmente y utilizarlo para el negocio. Con estos retos personales esperemos que Olga pueda lograr todas las metas que se proponga y continúe con este espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Olga, 18, is a young entrepreneur living in Puerto Limón, a pretty parish in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province, Ecuador.  The place is notable for lush vegetation that invades the communal land of the Tsáchila community that lives in the region.  Because the climate is hot, one can see lemon, papaya, tomato, coffee and avocado crops for the community’s use and to be sold.

Olga has a small neighborhood store here; she works 6 hours per day.  Her mother has taught her everything she should know and she wants to have an investment though which she can increase her merchandise to be able to increase her sales.  

Olga’s short-term goal is to be able to pay for her schooling and continue with her education.  She’d also like to buy a vehicle so she can get around more easily and to use if for the business.  With these personal goals, we expect that Olga will be able to reach all the goals she sets for herself and to continue with this entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lideres Emprendedores Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Lideres Emprendedores esta compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. María tiene 29 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de tres años, ella se dedica al servicio de  peluquería tiene su salón de belleza que se encuentran ubicado en una zona estratégica de la localidad de el Torno,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de peluquería como cremas para cabello y champo y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejoramiento de su negocio, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a  utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida a su familia, su deseo de la Sra. María es tener un  negocio estable.
texts.en:
Líderes Emprendedores Communal Bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man.  The president of the bank is María.  She is 29 years old and married with one child, 3.  She works in the hairdressing business.  She has her beauty salon located in a strategic area of the town of El Torno.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  María will use this loan to buy hairdressing supplies such as hair cream and shampoo, and in this way increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve her business.

María faces challenges in her business such as growing her clientele.  She is going to use the profits to improve her family's quality of life.  María's desire is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena, 50, is married with seven children. She runs a cereal store to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she does farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand it in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cereal to sell.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane, 49, is married with four children. She is a pig farmer and has been in the business for 12 years, employing one person. Jane describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save money and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 42, is married with seven children. He has operated a taxi transport business for 15 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand it in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es: La señora Isolda Graciela de 52 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora. Con iniciativa propia da incio a su negocio de cyber. Manifiesta Isolda que la principal motivacion para ella poder establcer dicho negocio fue apoyar al desarrallo economico de su hogar. Sumando a ello la demanda y a aun mas la necesidad extrema de lo que hoy en dia se ha convertido la tecnologia. En creditos anteriores ha podido mejorar lo que son sus equipos para asi brindarle un servicio mejor y de mayor velocidad a sus clientes de igual forrma comenzo con su octavo ciclo de credito un anexo de un cuarto. Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento lo que se propone  es realizar compras de materiales de construccion tales como: Hierro, bloques, cemento, arena, piedrin, perlines, golozos, soldaduras entre otros y asi empezar el plan de llevar a cabo la construccion de viga corona e instalacion de verjas en su hogar. Agradece la confiaza dada por Afodenic y Kiva.
texts.en:
Isolda Graciela, 52, is an enterprising woman.  With her own initiative she started an Internet access service.  Isolda states that the main motivation for her to open said business was to contribute to her home’s economic development.  Added to that is demand and the even more extreme need that technology has become nowadays.

She used previous loans to upgrade her equipment to offer better service and improved speed to her customers and with her 8th loan cycle started to add a room.  Now, with this latest financing she plans to buy building materials and supplies like rebar, concrete blocks, sand, gravel, purlines, screws, welding and others to start to carry out the construction of the weight bearing beam and to install metal grates on her house.  She is grateful for the trust Afodenic and Kiva have shown.

loans.use: to install a weight bearing beam and metal grates.

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Andrea F. mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y comerciante. Continua con su negocio de venta de comida, mismo que ha sido el sosten para ella poderles brindar lo mejor a su familia. Dentro de las necesidades que mas le apremian en estos momentos esta la edificación de su vivienda, motivo que le llevo una vez mas a recurrir a la micro-financiera para llevar a cabo la realizacion de muro perimetral y puertas de madera en su casa. Con el prestamo comprara estribos,bloques, alambre de amarre,hierro, arena, cemento, piedrin, piedras canteras, puertas de madera entre otros materiales. Agradece a la institucion por el apoyo a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su vivienda ya que le servira a que su descendencia obtenga protección y seguridad, la cual es una razon de importancia para su persona.
texts.en: Doña Andrea F. is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is in sales. Her business is selling food; it has been her main source of income to prove her family the best. One of Doña Andrea’s pressing needs is making repairs to her home, it is the reason for the loan, to build a border wall and buy wooden doors for her home. With the loan she will buy braces, cement blocks, wire, iron, sand, cement, gravel, quarry stones, wooden doors and other materials. Doña Andrea is thankful to the institution for helping her improve her quality of life and home since it will help her family be protected and secure which is very important to her.

loans.use: build a border wall and install wooden doors in her home.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, 32, is married with one child. He has operated a taxi business for two months and describes his business environment as competitive because many people drive taxis. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Samuel has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 54 years old and a mother of one child. She sells food to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans and maize.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 30 years old and is single. She sells various food items such as juice, bread, bananas, cakes etc and she has been in this business for five years. Her business is open from 6 am to 7 pm each week and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Francine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various food items such as juice, bread, bananas, cakes etc to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various food items such as juice, bread, bananas, cakes etc to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena madre soltera, es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y responsable. Su hijo ya mayor de edad quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Hoy en dia su labor es de domestica en una casa particular a su vez cuenta con su ingreso extra por ser comerciante de ropa de cama. Tras varios problemas económico que la han agobiado, por que ha sido una mujer sola que dentro de sus limitaciones económicas ha ofrecido a su hijo lo que dentro de sus alcances le han permitido. Lo que no ha podido alcanzar es una de sus grandes metas la cual ha sido el mejorar su humilde casa ya que su salario es muy bajo y no le da para comprar de una vez todos los materiales. Asegura sentirse muy contenta al ser Afodenic quien le brinda en este 2012 esta oportunidad de financiamiento para ella poder lograr su objetivo. Siendo este su primer ciclo de credito requiere comprar cemento, arena, hierro, piedrin bloques, perlines, golosos entre otros y asi levantar el muro de su vivienda, obteniendo con la infraestructura mayor seguridad a su vivienda, debido a que el lugar donde habita presenta sudun la policía nacional un alto índice de delincuencia que amenaza a sus pobladores quienes optan por reforzar la seguridad de sus hogares en pro de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena is a single mother.  She’s a very hardworking, honest, responsible woman.  Her adult son helps her with household expenses.  At present, she works as a domestic employee in a private home and she also earns extra money selling bed linens.  Despite several economic problems she’s suffered under because she’s a woman alone, within the economic limitations she’s had she managed to give her son everything she could.

What she hasn’t been able to reach is one of her greatest goals: to improve her humble house because her salary is too low and insufficient to permit her buying all the building materials she needs all at once.  She states that she feels very happy because Afodenic in this 2012 is offering her the opportunity of financing for her to reach her objective.

This is her first loan cycle and she needs to buy cement, sand, rebar, gravel, concrete blocks, purlines and screws, among others to build a wall at home thus obtaining more secure infrastructure for her home because according to the national police the area where she lives has a high crime index that threatens residents who opt for reinforced home security for their family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette mujer perseverante luego de trabajar en una zona franca trabajo que no le generaba los ingresos esperados por ella para sastifacer sus necesidades y las de sus hijos. Hoy en dia se dedica al oficio de cocina, inciandolo por ayuda de una hermana quien le consiguio el trabajo que tiene hasta el dia de hoy. Sin embargo manifiesta Jeanette que para aumentar sus ingresos tambien vende sandalias que sus mismos clientes le hacen previo a encargo. El hecho de ser ella madre soltera no le ha sido de impedimento para no poder lograr todo lo propuesto por su persona, ya que se considera una persona luchadora que alcanza lo que se propone. Con este su tercer ciclo de credito esta contenta por que Afodenic ha sido la puerta de financiamiento que desde tiempos atrás andaba buscando para hacerles mejoras a su vivienda, en esta ocasión su credito lo re-invertira en la construccion de su hogar que es uno de sus mayores objetivo puesto que considera que al comprar e invertirle a su casa esta cosechando mas éxito para y ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a perseverant woman.  After working in a free zone at a job that didn’t generate the expected income to meet her and her children’s needs, she now works as a cook having started thanks to help from her sister who got her the job she has to date.

However, Jeanette states that in order to increase her income she also sells sandals to her customers who place prior orders with her.  The fact of being a single mother has not been an impediment for her to reach everything she’s proposed for herself because she considers herself to be a tenacious person who reaches her goals.

With this third loan cycle she is happy because Afodenic has been the doorway to financing which she had been searching for since a long time ago to make home improvements.  

On this occasion, she will reinvest her loan in her home’s construction because this is one of her main goals because she feels that by buying to invest in the house she’s reaping more success for her and hers.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia tiene la edad de 44 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Ana es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi. Ella tenía que buscar el medio para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Ana son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que Ana solicito un financiamiento  en Fundación León 2000 con el fin de aplicarle reparaciones y proporcionarle mantenimiento a su vehículo. Y así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana Julia is 44 years old, married and has 3 children under her care. Ana’s work is providing transportation with a taxi. She had to find a way to improve her family’s earnings, Doña Ana hopes to keep her business growing since everything that she has, has taken a lot of effort and she doesn’t want to loose it. This is why Ana sought a loan from Fundación León 2000, to make repairs and provide maintenance repairs to her vehicle that will help her provide better services to her customers.

loans.use: make repairs and provide maintenance repairs to her vehicle.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 57 years old, married with one child. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy feeds for her dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a traditional ger (nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is employed by a private company. Her children go to the secondary schools. She has been running a food store business since 2006. The business activity has been stable. She owns a small van which she uses to purchase the supplies wholesale. Uuganbayar is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to develop my business by purchasing supplies in large quantities. I will spend the loan funds for the benefit of the business". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy food store inventory.

loans.use: To buy food store inventory

loans.name: Las Marianas Group

texts.es:
Las Marianas, nombre producto de su fe, es un grupo de emprendedoras mujeres que ha decidido invertir en sus negocios para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Hilda, una de sus integrantes, es esposa y madre de dos niños. Ella impulsada por apoyar económicamente a su esposo y  con la intención de mejorar su calidad de vida y con ello incrementar los ingresos familiares, se puso a pensar en opciones de negocio, se decidió por establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio e inicio la venta.
Este negocio se ha fortalecido y esta tomando el compromiso de este préstamo para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda.
Hilda, esta segura que su esfuerzo da frutos.
texts.en:
Las Marianas Communal Bank, a name taken after their own faith, they are a group of enterprising women who decided to invest in their businesses to have a better quality of life.

Hilda is one of the members; she is a wife and a mother to two children. She is driven to help her husband financially, improve their quality of life and earnings. As Hilda thought of different businesses to start she decided for a small grocery store in her home.

This business has grown and is committed to pay back the loan that will be used to buy merchandize to stock her store.

Hilda is sure that her hard work will be rewarded.

loans.use: buy merchandize to stock her store.

loans.name: La Playita 2012 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La playita 2012 esta integrado por diez mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de mejorar sus vidas, mujeres indígenas, todas hablan el idioma  mixteco nos dicen que están orgullosas de su lengua sus culturas y raíces.
Son originarias de un pueblo llamado San Lorenzo para ellas su localidad  es tierra de cultura de gente artesana ya que la mayoría de las mujeres se dedican a la venta  y elaboración de servilletas, manteles y huipiles.
Antes de llegar a  San Lorenzo  hay un pequeño Rió llamado rió de la arena hay muchos árboles  verdes y un pequeño templo llamado la Nueva Jerusalén.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo  es la señorita Guadalupe de  veinte cinco años de edad quien se caracteriza por ser una persona alegre y amable.
Nos dice que  uno de sus deseos es superarse  y demostrarle al mundo su cultura sus raíces y su lengua.
Lupe como mejor la conocen nos dice que se dedica a venta y elaboración de servilletas desde hace dos años.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es combinar los colores al tejer creando verdaderas obras de arte, y otra cosa que le gusta es que le deja buenas ganancias.
Y lo que menos le gusta  es que se cansa mucho de la mano y en ocasiones se cansa de la vista.
Nos cuenta  que sus servilletas las vende por pedidos ya que se las encargan quince días antes  ya que los pedidos que le encargan son para cumpleaños, quince años y bodas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas materiales para la elaboración de servilletas como es: cuadrille, hilos de colores hiló de seda y aros.
A parte de comprar  sus materiales para  la elaboración de sus servilletas nos dice que va adquirir otro bien ya que va a darle mantenimiento a su maquina de  tejer.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a la gente  indígena con deseos de superarse  y dar a conocer  sus raíces.
Las otras integrantes son:
Roció- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Inés- se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Apolinaria- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Elena- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Nemesia- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Verónica- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ciria- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Celerina- se dedica a la venta de carne.
Catalina- se dedica a la venta de mercancía  de abarrotes.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion apoyarla a las personas de pueblos maquinados.
texts.en:
This group is called La Playita 2012.  It is made up of 10 hardworking women with a desire to improve their lives.  Indigenous women, they all speak the Mixtec language.  They tell us they are proud of their language, cultures, and roots.

They are natives of a town called San Lorenzo.  For them their town is a land of culture, of artistic people, because the majority of the women work selling and making napkins, tablecloths, and huipiles [traditional woven blouses].  Before arriving at San Lorenzo there is a small river, Río de la Arena.  There are a lot of green trees and a small temple called Nueva Jerusalén.

One of the members of this group is Guadalupe, 25, who is known for being a happy and nice person.  She tells us that one of her desires is to improve herself and show the world her culture, her roots, and her language.  Lupe, as she is better known, tells us she has worked selling and making napkins for two years.  What she likes most about her business is combining the colors while weaving, creating true works of art.  Another thing she likes is it gives her good profits.  And what she likes least is that her hand tires, and sometimes her vision tires.

She tells us she sells her napkins on order because they are commissioned two weeks in advance for birthdays, "quinceañeras" [birthdays for fifteen-year-old girls], and weddings.

She requested the loan to buy more materials to make napkins, such as quadrilles, colored thread, silk thread, and hoops.

Besides buying her materials to make her napkins, she tells us she is going to acquire other goods because she is going to perform maintenance on her sewing machine.

She thanks the foundation for helping the indigenous people who want to improve themselves and make their roots known.  The other members are Rocío, who sells perfume; Inés, who sells chicken; Apolinaria, who sells bread; Elena, who sells grocery merchandise; Nemesia, who sells perfume; Verónica, who sells clothing; Ciria, who sells clothing; Celerina, who sells meat; and Catalina, who sells grocery merchandise.

They thank the foundation for helping people from marginalized communities.

loans.use: to buy materials to make napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and married with one child. He has a taxi business to earn a living. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. To earn extra income he does farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old and married with three children. She runs a car transport business to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed three people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tires for her car.

loans.use: To buy tires for her car.

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es: Patrona  de los Ángeles su actividad económica es  mercadería variada ha sido una emprendedora muy trabajadora, responsables ella inicio su negocio como una necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para el bienestar económica personal y de su familia, gracias a su tenacidad y persistencia ha podida mantener el negocio por muchos años a pesar de la mucha competencia que tiene, esto lo ha logrado con el apoyo que fundación le ha brindado con los financiamiento para la compra de mercadería que necesita para ofrecerle a su clientela como: cosméticos, prendas de oro y plata, ropa de niño, ropa de adulto, zapatos de diferentes estilos, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en:
Patrona de los Ángeles has a business in which she sells various merchandise. She is a hardworking and responsible entrepreneur who started her business because she needed work in order to provide for her personal financial well-being and that of her family. Thanks to her tenacity and persistence, she has been able to maintain her business for many years despite the high level of competition. She has been able to do this with the support of Fundación León 2000.

Her loan will be used to buy necessary merchandise that she can offer to her customers such as cosmetics, gold and silver jewelry, children's clothing, adult clothing, shoes of different styles, undergarments, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, gold and silver jewelry, children's clothing, adult clothing, shoes of different styles, undergarments, and other products.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is 30 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. She also takes care of one relative who is 23 years old. She sells various goods such as Colgate, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc., and she has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily except on Sunday, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Molly has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as Colgate, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to reinvest in her business, and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as Colgate, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 27 years old and married with one child. He sells electronics to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy radio speakers to sell.

loans.use: To buy radio speakers to sell.

loans.name: Isaias Escardo

texts.es:
Isaías Escardo tiene 46 años de edad es soltero  tiene dos hijos vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. Pertenece a la Ventanilla rural Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Isaías Escardo se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Solicita el crédito para comprar animales como cerdos, pollos. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para comercializarlos.
Las compras y las ventas de animales las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Caluma cada semana.
Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia y dar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el factor climático exceso de lluvias.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Isaías Escardo is 46 years old, single, and lives with his two children in the canton of Montavo, Los Ríos Province. Isaías is a member of the Communal Bank "Embarcadero Chico". The members engage in the cultivation of cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, cassava, plantains, and the breeding of animals.

Isaías Escardo grows cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, plantains, and raises animals. He is requesting a loan to buy animals, such as pigs and chickens. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy animals to sell. The purchase and sale of animals are conducted frequently in the canton of Caluma each week. His dreams are to have a house of his own and to provide his children a better future. The challenges he faces include weather factors, such as excessive rain.

In his free time, Isaías Escardo enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 36 years old. He runs a hardware store to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy pipes, window panes and glass to sell.

loans.use: To buy pipes, window panes and glass to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a farmer living in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Each month, Judith earns 6000 PHP from farming. She is able to help provide for her family's basic needs with her income. Judith plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alvaro Vladimir

texts.es: El Sr. Álvaro tiene 26 años y es soltero, se dedica  ala confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años el confecciona chamarras deportivas, su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Alto Tacagua. Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr.  Alvaro  va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión. El Sr.  Álvaro  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. , el Sr. Álvaro es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Álvaro is a 26 year old single man who has been making dress clothes for a few years now. He makes sports jackets and his shop is located in his home which is located in the zone of Alto Tacagua. This loan is his first with this microfinance institution. Álvaro will use the loan to purchase fabric to make his wholesale dress clothing. He wants to take out the loan to increase his investment capital. Álvaro faces the challenge of increasing the income of his business. He's going to utilize the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make good quality clothing and in this way, increase his customers' orders. Álvaro is a very hardworking person; he feels happy and grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: purchase fabric.

loans.name: Rosalva Marily

texts.es:
Rosalva es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de un pequeño de 2 años al cual ama muchísimo y es su adoración aunque a su edad le saque canas verdes porque es muy travieso pero en cada travesura que el hace siempre le roba una sonrisa. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, asimismo tiene como actividades la agricultura en especial el cultivo de Arroz y también la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su familia.

Día a día Rosalva se esfuerza en su negocio, ella es costurera, su negocio lo realiza en su domicilio, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender 5 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicada a su trabajado y es muy cumplida con los clientes.

Rosalva está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá telas para realizar sus confecciones y también para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Darle la mejor educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Rosalva is a very hardworking woman, she is a mother to a 2 year old whom she loves very much and is her devotion, although at his age, he gives her green hair because he is very restless but each mischief gives her a smile. Her home is located in the city Camana, a city characterized by its beautiful beaches, agriculture, especially the rice fields, and fishing. When Rosalva has free time she likes to go out with her family.

Day to day, Rosalva works hard in her business, she is a seamstress, a job that she does in her home. She works about 10 hours a day and cares for 5 customers daily. Rosalva believes her business does well because she is very dedicated to her work and finishes her work on time.

Rosalva is very thankful with the Kiva lenders since thanks to your help, she will be able to buy fabric to make her items as well as making some improvements to her home. This will help her improve her earnings and quality of life which will allow her to keep working hard each day to make her greatest dream come true: “Give her son a better education.”

loans.use: buy fabric and make some improvements to her home.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 45 years old and is married with five children aged between 2 and 13 years old. He takes care of 7 dependents. He sells beans, potatoes, and bananas, which are contained in sacks and he has been in this business for seven years. Jean Pierre currently employs two people to help him. 

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of beans, potatoes, and bananas which are contained in sacks for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, reinvest in his business and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of beans, potatoes, and bananas which are contained in sacks for resale

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna has been engaged in beekeeping for a long time. She likes her occupation very much. Ruzanna says that beekeeping is labor intensive but she likes to spend time with her bee families and to work in the open air. Ruzanna's family also helps her in her occupation as it is the main source of income for them. Ruzanna produces high quality honey and she is able to sell it directly from her house to her regular customers.  

Ruzanna is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a truck, which will allow her family to move their bee families to a forest during summer months. 

Ruzanna is 51 years old. She lives in Ijevan with her husband and a son. Ruzanna's daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents. Simultaneously with beekeeping, Ruzanna and her son work as accountants; her husband works as a welder.

loans.use: to buy a truck, which will allow her family to move their bee families to a forest during summer months

loans.name: Sahuaro Group

texts.es:
La señora   María del Carmen es casada con el señor Adán  con quien procreo  seis hijos quienes cinco  ya están casados   y una a un está a su responsabilidad.

       Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollo de granja para luego venderlo  destazado en donde lleva  trabajando  tres años tres meses en la que comenta que le va  bien ya que con a sacado  adelante a su familia.

      Ella se dedica a esta actividad para  generar sus ingresos y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su  hogar y tener lo  más necesario.

       En este tipo de negocio se  animo  ella solo para así  generar sus propios ingresos y  así darle lo  más necesario a su pequeña familia.

       Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo  ella siga aumentando do día con día su negocio ya que solo vende los miércoles y los domingos.

      Quienes integran en el grupo son: Zoraida quien esta trabajando el préstamo  en la compra y venda de cosméticos de jafra, María Estela invierte el préstamo en la compra de materiales para elaborar piñatas, Guadalupe invierte en la compra y venta de pollos, Lorena invertir en la compra y venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon, María Neófita invertirá en la compra de materiales para  la elaboración de ropas y la señora María  Magdalena invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sra. María del Carmen is married to Sr. Adán. They have six children, five of whom are married and one still under their responsibility. María buys and sells farm-raised chickens that she offers butchered. She has been working for three years and three months and says that she has done well enough to move her family forward. María dedicates herself to her business in order to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses to provide what they need. In this type of business, she is excited about being able to earn her own income so that she can provide her small family with the most important necessities. With this loan for her small business, María would like to increase her business day after day. She works alone, selling on Wednesdays and Sundays.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Zoraida will use her loan for her work of buying and selling Jafra cosmetics. • María Estela will invest her loan in the purchase of materials for making piñatas. • Guadalupe will invest in buying and selling chickens. • Lorena will invest in buying and selling Avon cosmetics. • María Neófita will invest in materials for making clothes. • Sra. María Magdalena will invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Las Palomas 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  "Las Palomas 1" esta conformado  por cuatro personas humildes, indígenas con deseos de salir adelante cambiar sus vidas y la de su familia.
Son   originarios  de un pequeño pueblo llamado San Juanito municipio de San Juan Jicayan  donde la mayoría de los ciudadanos hablan el idioma Mixteco, alguna de las mujeres se dedican a tejer y los hombres se dedican a la siembra de maíz.
Una de las tradiciones de la comunidad  es la fiesta del pueblo  que se celebra los días 24 de julio que es el día de Santiago Apóstol.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señorita Beatriz de veinte cinco años de edad, es una persona  alegre y un poco  platicadora.
Beti como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  nos dice que se dedica a la venta de servilletas y de tamales desde hace cinco años los distintos sabores de tamales que hace son: tichinda (almeja de color negro), camarón, pollo, pescado y costilla de marrano.
Nos cuenta su venta la realiza comentando en su comunidad que tiene tamales y así la gente va a comprar tamales a su casa, ella vende 3 veces a la semana entonces las personas ya saben cuales son los días que ella vende. 
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es cuando elabora el chile que le va poner a la carne para que no salga muy picoso y el Tamale tenga un buen sabor.
Una de las cosas que le impiden seguir con su negocio es que en ocasiones no tiene los recursos para comprar el necesario para hacer sus tamales.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboración  de tamales como son:
Chile verde, chile seco, jitomate, cebolla, ajo, hojas de plátano para envolver el tamal, manteca, carne y camarón.
Nos  dice que con el crédito desea adquirir más maíz para la elaboración de tamales y para  su alimentación.
Le da las gracias a fundacion  por el apoyo y sobre todo por ayudara a las mujeres indígenas y no discriminara a nadie  por su lengua y vestimenta.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Patricia- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Cresenciano- se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Ernestina- se dedica a  la venta de pescado.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a todas las personas con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Palomas 1" (The Doves 1) and is composed of four humble, indigenous people who want to get ahead in life for themselves and their families.They are natives of a small town called San Juanito in the municipality of San Juan Jicayan, where the majority of citizens speak the Mixteco language. One of this community's traditions is the town party that is celebrated on July 24, which is Santiago Apóstol Day. 

One of the women is a seamstress and the men grow corn. One of the group members is Beatriz, who is 25 years old. She is a quiet and happy person. Beti, as her group members know her, tells us that she has been selling napkins and tamales for five years now. The different kinds of tamales she makes are: tichinda (black clams), shrimp, chicken, fish and pork ribs. 

The people go to buy tamales at her house. She sells them 3 times a week and her customers already know on which days she sells them. What she likes most about her business is when she prepares the chile that she puts on the meat. It gives a good flavor without being too spicy. 

One of the things that hinders her business is that she sometimes does not have the resources to buy the necessary ingredients to make her tamales.
She is taking out the loan to buy more ingredients to make tamales, such as: green chile, dried chile, tomato, onion, garlic, banana leaves to wrap the tamal in. 

She is grateful to the Fundación for its support and above all, for helping indigenous women. They don't discriminate against anyone for their language or for the way they dress. 

The other group members are: Patricia - she sells embroidery, Cresenciano - she sells cattle, Ernestina - she sells fish. They are grateful to the Fundación for helping all those people who wish to better themselves.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make tamales and napkins.

loans.name: Munkhtsooj

texts.en: Munkhtsooj, 40, has been running a karaoke and cafeteria business with her husband for 4 years. She used to have a business selling casual clothes to Russian border cities before. She lives with her husband and her daughter in a common apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This business is the main income source for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy 2 LCD televisions and an air conditioner for her karaoke rooms. She said it is a good thing to improve her business quality and service for customers.

loans.use: To buy 2 LCD televisions and an air conditioner for her karaoke rooms.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg, 49, runs a collection point of recycle materials in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business with her husband for 15 years. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic yurt. Her business earnings do not usually match her family necessities. This summer she is planning to build a house for her family on her plot of land which is in the ger district because she thinks her family needs a bigger house and better living conditions in the future. Now she needs some money to buy the necessary building materials to complete her family house.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to complete her family house.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a thirty-year-old man who is married with one child. He owns rental houses in Gachie. He has been in the business for seven years now. He gets a monthly income of two hundred and eighty-eight thousand shillings


This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to finish up his rental houses. In the future he wants to boost his business and support his family.

loans.use: to finish up his rental houses

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva has been running a trading business for about 7 years. She sells adults' and children's clothes, shoes, tablecloths, bedspreads, blankets, hats, etc. Once a month Silva goes to a neighboring country where she buys merchandise for her business. Silva has many regular customers as her stall's assortment is rather various and all of them could find almost everything required.  

Silva is 47 years old and she lives in Ijevan with her husband. Silva’s husband helps her in the business and thus they provide for themselves. She is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy spring and summer season clothes and shoes to resell. This is Silva’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer season clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a divorced woman with six children between the ages of 11 and 21 years, all of whom are enrolled in school. She operates a grocery and has been in this business for the last 10 years.  Other sources of income include sales from farm produce. She aspires to open a kiosk in the future and she describes seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanasha lives in her own house that has piped water, but no electricity. With the Ksh 20,000, she plans to expand her business by purchasing tomatoes, potatoes, and some vegetables.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing tomatoes, potatoes, and some vegetables.

loans.name: Jangaa

texts.en: Jangaa is a married man with two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. He lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. He operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) and has a retail shop as his side business. His primary customers are the local residents, and he describes seasonality and competition as his major challenges. Jangaa dreams of opening a shop in future. He plans to use the Ksh 10,000 to add stock of wheat and maize flour to his kiosk.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat and maize flour to his retail.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a divorced man who has four children; all are in school. He has been operating a goat meat business for the last three years. He sells his products mostly to slaughter houses. Juma’s side business is farming, and he says that he spends more on food over the month. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. With the loan of Ksh 20,000, he intends to purchase goats for sale.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old single woman, blessed with three children, aged between seven and fifteen years. She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for twelve years, giving her a monthly income of KES 12000. 
She borrowed her first loan of KES 20000 from KADET LTD and intends to use it to purchase mattresses (KES 10000), gumboots (KES 7000), and clothing (KES 3000).  
The earned money will be put back into her business to improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to prosper in business.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses, gumboots, and clothing for resale

loans.name: Simon Bolivar

texts.es:
Simón Bolívar tiene 47 años de edad es soltera vive con sus familiares en Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Embarcadero Chico se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.

Simón Bolívar se dedica al cultivo de cacao, naranja, guineo, orito, yuca, plátano y a la cría de animales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales cómo cemento, barillas, bloque para arreglo de su casa. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá hacer los arreglos a la casa.

Las compras lo hará en el Cantón Montalvo. Su sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa.
Los desafíos a los cuales se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a su familia pasando junto a ellos.
texts.en:
Simón Bolívar is 47 years old, single, and lives with his relatives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Communal Bank "Embarcadero Chico". The members engage in the cultivation of cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, cassava, plantains, and the breeding of animals.

Simón Bolívar grows cacao, oranges, baby bananas, cooking bananas, plantains, and raises animals. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as cement, rods, and blocks for repairing his house. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make these renovations. His purchases are made in the canton of Montalvo. His dream is to have a house of his home. The challenges he faces include crop diseases.

In his free time, Simón Bolívar enjoys spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, rods, and blocks for repairing his home.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 51 year-old business lady. She is married to Thiga, a businessman. They are blessed with four children. Salome has been selling hair weaves and cosmetics for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 35,000 that she uses to support her four family members.  

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. Salome will use the loan to purchase hair weaves and cosmetic products. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to expand her business and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to meet market demand for hair weaves.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves and cosmetic products

loans.name: Patroba

texts.en:
Patroba is a married lady aged 38 years who is supporting five members of her family. She is blessed with four children aged between 15 and seven years old. She buys and sells fresh milk and has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.  

Right now, she is servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase more fresh milk for sale.  The profits will be used to renovate the working area and improve the welfare of her family. She hopes to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh milk for resale and storage containers

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 40 años, está casada con Guzmán, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años. A los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de Yaroca, distrito de Palca – Tarma. Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Aurelia dice que le agrada esta actividad por su libertad y autonomía. En todo este tiempo aprendió a producir arvejas, papas, gladiolos y maíz. Pero afirma que los productos que más satisfacción le generan son las flores de gladiolos y arvejas. “Cada temporada siembra 3 bolsas de gladiolos”, dice. Por otro lado, su esposo, cuenta con 2 carros de su propiedad, con los que trabaja brindando servicios de transporte. Con ambas actividades pueden solventar sus gastos básicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Les va muy bien.
Es por eso que para más adelante Aurelia, desea comprar más autos y de esa manera abarcar más poblados lejanos. Para entonces sus hijos ya tendrán la edad suficiente para hacerse cargo de esas labores. Este sería su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Le agrada el trabajo con su banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroca”, por la solidaridad entre las socias.
De recibir el dinero podrá comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas con 1800 soles. Lo restante será para comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos para fortalecer la siembra de arvejas.
texts.en: Aurelia is 40 years old, she is married to Guzmán, with whom she has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 12. They raise and educate them in the home they own in the village of Yaroca, in the Palca district of the Tarma region in Peru. She has worked in agriculture for over 20 years. Aurelia says she enjoys this activity because of the freedom and independence it affords her. In all those years, she learned how to grow peas, potatoes, gladioli and corn, but she says that the ones she enjoys most are the flowers and the peas. "Every season, I plant 3 sacks of gladiolus seeds", she says. As for her husband, he owns two cars with which he works offering transport services in both directions between Tarma and Palca. Thanks to these two activities, they are able to cover basic expenses and better their quality of life. That is why in the future Aurelia hopes to buy more cars and thus offer transport to more towns that are far away. At that point in time her sons would be old enough to take up that activity. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, thus she gives her word that she will pay her monthly installments on time. She likes working with her village bank "Las Truchitas de Yaroca" because  of the solidarity between the members. With this loan, she will be able to buy 3 sacks of pea seeds with 1800 soles. The rest she will use to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 44-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan and  a mother of six children.

Dalal makes dairy products and she is requesting a  loan of 500 JD to purchase materials needed for her home-based business. She is looking to increase her sales volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making dairy products

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24-year-old man from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and he is about to get married. He is requesting a loan of 1700 JD to cover his wedding expenses and purchase furniture for his new home. Alaa is dreaming of a stable life and many children.

Because Alaa is under 30 years old his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his new home and cover part of his wedding expenses

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. He distributes different goods to shops and other retailers using his van, so he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase new quantities of goods for his business. He is looking to establish a shop for his business and purchase a house.

Because Mohammad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase goods for distribution

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 56-year-old married woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan. She works from her home where she makes "Maftool", a traditional kind of food in Jordan, and some other kinds of foods.

Jameela sells her products to neighbours and friends, then with her exceptional dishes she is able to sell her products to malls and hospitals. She is looking to improve her family's living conditiona and renew her house furniture.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making "maftool" and other kinds of food

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa vive ( suburbio guayaquil ) ella gracias a D-miro a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas y le ha ayudado a que se preparen en sus estudios . El esposo sigue en el exterior trabajando todos los dias . con el prestamo comprara ( papeleria utiles ) a futuro ella quiere seguir haciendo y trabajando con D-miro .
texts.en: Rosa lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  Thanks to D-Miro she’s managed to move her daughters forward and it’s helped her so that they can prepare themselves in their studies.  Her husband continues abroad and she continues working every day.  She will use the loan to buy stationery items and school supplies.  In the future she wants to continue making and working with D-Miro.

loans.use: to buy stationary and other gift shop items

loans.name: Fadyah

texts.en:
Fadyah is a 29-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase new furniture.

Because Fadyah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a 24-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to do maintenance on her house.

Because Rula is under 30 years old her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus she refused to be photographed, the man in the photo is her son.

Alia is a 50-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions. Currently she is building a house and is requesting a loan of 800 JD to finalize her new house construction.

loans.use: to finalize her house construction

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her husband.

Sahar is a 28-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions so she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to paint her house and purchase new furniture.

Because Sahar is under 30 years old her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to paint her house and purchase new furniture

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. She is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet so the man in the photo is her husband.

Rania sells blankets and she works from her house. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more blankets for business purposes. Because Rania is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase blankets for business purposes

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 40-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child. He has a mobile phone shop. He started his business years ago in a small shop, partnering with a friend. Then he was able to expand the business and purchase his friend's share in the shop.

Now. Yaser is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase more phones for business purposes. Yaser is looking to expand his business and purchase a photocopier.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones for business purposes

He is looking to open a shop for his business and improve his family's living conditions.

Because Waleed is under 30 years old, his loan is considered as a youth loan.

Aren is looking to expand her home-based business and establish a shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Because Aren is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

Now, she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes and blankets for business purposes. An aspiration of Amani is to purchase a house for her family. Because Amani is under 30 years old, her loan is considered as a youth loan.
