loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina, de 39 años, es una mujer centrada. Vive junto a sus hijos: Ruthy y Alison a los que cuida con mucho esmero, por si sola en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Para sacar a sus hijos adelante, trabaja todos los días desde las primeras horas del día hasta el anochecer. Por las mañanas se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, las cuales vende a la semana en la feria ganadera que se realiza en su localidad, donde cuenta que vende un promedio de 6 a 7 ejemplares. Ella es muy inteligente, pues no rebaja el precio de los animales, al contrario si no le ofrecen la cantidad alta, prefiere mantener sus animales hasta la próxima feria donde siempre encontró mejores postores, es así que ella encuentra la manera de obtener mayores beneficios. “Mi hermano me ayuda, pues es técnico zootecnista”, comenta. Por otro lado, trabaja cuidando la la gobernación de su localidad. Sin embargo para ella su trabajo de ganadería es improtante, por ello elabora proyectos, realizando capacitaciones a los agricultores y ganaderos, pero las lluvias suspendieron sus labores, pero está segura que pronto lo retomará. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Fernando”, este es el crédito número octavo con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Liduvina de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado ovino, pues en está temporada cuestan menos y desea sacar provecho para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Liduvina, 39, is a well centered woman.  She lives with her children, Ruthy and Alison, who she cares for with dedication by herself in her own house located in Chilca.  In order to raise her children she works every day from dawn to dusk.  In the morning she raises sheep which she sells weekly at the local livestock market selling on average 6 or 7 sheep.  She is very intelligent because she does not drop the price.  On the contrary, if she’s not offered the price she wants she prefers not to sell and wait until the next week’s market where she always finds better offers so she can earn better profits that way.  “My brother helps me because he’s an animal husbandry technician,” she comments.  In the evenings, she also works caretaking city hall. 

But because work for her is important, she also carries out projects training farmers and cattlemen.  Because of the rain this work has been suspended but she’s sure to restart it soon.

She belongs to the “San Fernando” communal bank and this is the 8th MFP loan.  She feels happy because she found the help she so needed to head toward her objectives.  She is responsible with all her tasks so promises to be punctual with her payments.

If Liduvina were to receive your help, she’ll use the money requested to buy several heads of sheep because they cost less at this time and she wants to take advantage of this to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla y alegre. Vive desde hace 30 años junto a Mergildo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. El trabajo el que se dedica está abnegada mujer es la compra y venta de animales, en especial ovejas. Las cuales compra a menor precio en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad todos los fines de semana. Ahí se dedica a comprar en principal crías, las cuales cuida con mucha dedicación y cuando están maduras la vende a mayor precio. Además de tener un ingreso adicional,  cuida el estadio de su localidad por las noches; de ahí recibe un ingreso extra los fines de mes,  que le ayuda sobre todo a mejorar sus ingresos considerablemente. Su mayor deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y hacer crecer su negocio, obteniendo más ganados y por ende mayores ganancias.  “Mi esposo trabaja como profesor en el magisterio, ahí obtiene un ingreso extra, deseo que mis hijos logren ser  profesionales como él”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Fernando”, este es el crédito número catorce con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos. Teofila de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas en gran cantidad, pues en está fecha el precio de compra es menor y quiere aprovechar la temporada.
texts.en:
Teofila, 48, is an unassuming, cheerful woman.  She’s lived with her husband, Mergildo, for 30 years.  They have three children she cares for in her own house located in Chilca.  The work this self-sacrificing woman does is buying and selling livestock, especially sheep that she buys at a lower price at the livestock market that takes place every weekend in the city.  

She buys mainly young litters there that she cares for with much dedication and when they are mature she sells them at a higher price.  She also has an additional source of income.  She is a night caretaker at the local stadium and earns a salary at the end of each month which helps her to improve her income considerably.  

Her greatest wish is to improve her income and to make her business grow obtaining more livestock and thus higher profits.  “My husband works as a teacher and earns extra income there; I hope my children become professionals like him,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “San Fernando” communal bank and this is MFP loan #14.  She feels happy because she found the help she so needed to reach her goals.  She is responsible with all her tasks so promises to be punctual with her payments.  

If Teofila were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy sheep in large amounts because around this time price is lower and she wants to take advantage of the season.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique es un hombre responsable, vive en compañía de sus padres, sus hermanos a los que cuida mucho. A pesar de sus 26 años, es un hombre líder en Pampas, lugar donde vive. Todas las mañanas y desde las primera horas del día, se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde, ayuda a sus padres en el cultivo de cereales y demás productos oriundos de la zona. Cuenta que desde niño le gusto el campo, por ello no deja de tener esa costumbre de regar las plantas y sembrar la tierra. Pero como quiere progresar, por las tardes, dedica todo su esfuerzo en el puesto de celulares que tiene, donde vende todo producto móvil, además de carcasas para cambiar los equipos electrónicos y asistencia técnica a sus clientes que llegan constantemente. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio y expander sus horizontes, por ello viaja a la capital para poder comprar más mercadería. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente muy satisfecha de poder, desarrollar sus actividades con normalidad, pues tiene el apoyo de todos ustedes. Además promete cargar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que siempre fue una persona trabajadora y honrada. Enrique de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de repuestos para su negocio de celulares.
texts.en:
Enrique is a responsible man. He lives in the company of his parents and siblings, whom he cares for greatly. In spite of his meager 26 years, he is a leading man in Pampas where he lives. 

Every morning starting at the crack of dawn he goes to his agricultural plots of land where he helps his parents in the cultivation of cereals and other products native to the region. He says that since he was a child he has enjoyed the country, so he has continued the ritual of watering the plants and sowing the earth. But as he wants to get ahead, in the afternoon he dedicates his efforts to his cell phone stand. There he sells all types of cell phone products, in addition to casings to change electronic equipment and technical assistance for customers who are constantly coming by. 

Now he wants to improve his business and expand his horizons, so he traveled to the capital in order to buy more merchandise. This is his third loan with MFP, where he's been very satisfied with the ability to develop his business normally, as he has the support of all of you. Furthermore he promises to meet all his payments in a punctual manner; he has always been a hardworking and honorable person. Upon receiving the loan, Enrique will invest the requested funds in the purchase of spare parts for his cell phone business.

loans.use: to buy parts for cell phones.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 55 años de edad, casado con julia de 48 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen 4 hijos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la asociación de vista alegre del distrito de Pichari. Félix un hombre trabajador y muy cumplido con los deberes del hogar, él se dedica a la extracción de maderas así como también a la agricultura. La madera que extrae los vende en bloques a las carpinterías, cuenta que en el valle ya es difícil encontrar madera por lo que tiene que ingresar a la selva, en busca de buena madera, esto mas o menos le lleva una o dos semanas. Una vez aserrado la madera es trasladada a hombro por personales hasta la carretera luego es transportada con vehículos especiales de carga, para luego comercializarlos. Félix esta contento con esta labor que realiza pues así como extrae tantos árboles también tiene la obligación de sembrar otras nuevas con la finalidad de reponer y contribuir con el medio ambiente.
En adelante está pensando comprarse una nueva motosierra. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3, 500 nuevos soles comprará herramientas y cadena para su motosierra.
texts.en:
Felix is 55 years old and is married to Julia who is 48.  This great love has produced 4 children.  They live in their own home located in the community of Vista Alegre in the district of Pichari.  

Felix is a hardworking man who is very accomplished with household projects.  He works in logging and also in agriculture.  He sells the wood he fells in blocks to carpenter’s workshops.  As it is now difficult to find wood in the valley, he must go into the forest to find good wood.  This takes more or less one or two weeks. After it is cut down, the wood is transported on the shoulders of workers to the highway and then is transported with special cargo vehicles and sold.  

Felix is happy with the work that he does, and as he fells so many trees, he also has the obligation to plant new ones so as to replace the trees and contribute to the environment. In the future he is thinking about buying a new chainsaw.  This is his third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he promises to make his payments on time.  With the 3,500 nuevos soles he will buy tools and a chain for his chainsaw.

loans.use: to purchase tools and a chain for his chainsaw

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad convive con Macedonio de 40 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen 2 hijos. Juntos  viven en su casa propia ubicado en la asociación de vista alegre del distrito de Sivia. María dedicada a la venta de madera, trabaja junto con su querido esposo, quien es el encargado en realizar la extracción de las madera, para ello contrata 4 peones, dos de ellos son los encargados en aserrar, mientras que su esposo y otra persona más se encargan de transportar con el vehiculo toda la madera. Sus productos una vez extraído los comercializa en el distrito de Sivia a los acopiadores de madera y a los carpinteros. Cuenta además que realizar éste trabajo no es tan fácil por que primeramente tiene que tener licencia, pues si no estaría realizando un trabajo ilícito por el que seria decomisado los productos inclusive ser encarcelada. María está contenta con esta labor que realizan por que les genera una buena rentabilidad, ella mas adelante esta pensando abrir una tienda de ropa. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará árboles para luego aserrarlos.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and lives with 40-year-old Macedonio. As a result of their great love they have 2 children. They live together in their own house located in the village of Vista Alegre in the district of Sivia. 

María works selling wood together with her beloved husband, who manages the logging. To help with this work, they hire four laborers; two of them are in charge of sawing, while her husband and one other person use a vehicle to transport all of the wood. Their products are then sent out to market in the district of Sivia to carpenters and to middlemen who sell the wood. She also says that doing this job is not easy. In the first place, she must have a license, otherwise, she would be doing illegal work. As a result, her products would be confiscated and she would be imprisoned. 

María is happy with her work because it generates an excellent profit. In the future, she is thinking of opening a clothing store. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and therefore she has committed herself once more to punctually paying off her outstanding balance. With the 3,000 nuevos soles she will buy trees to be sawed later on.

loans.use: to buy trees.

in the photo Ahmad is standing on the front door of his shop , Al Kefah Shop.

loans.name: Melia

texts.es:
La señora Melia, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos y a su esposo en el municipio de Langue, al sur de Honduras. 
La señora Melia se dedica a la venta de golosinas , como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortas de pescado, sopas, pollo frito, tamales, frescos, agua, etc.
Melia esta solicitando su crédito de 10,000.00 para la compra de Carnes, tortillas, refrescos, agua y otros productos para elaborar sus golosinas y de esta forma tener variedad de productos para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes además de atender todos sus pedidos.
Los planes de doña Melia  son seguir trabajando en su negocio, tratar de fortalecerlo más y lograr acaparar más clientes, para mejorar sus ingresos.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Melia is 38 years old and married, with two children.  She lives with them and her husband in the town of Langue, in southern Honduras. Melia sells food, such as tacos, enchiladas, fish tortas, soups, fried chicken, tamales, soft drinks, water, etc.

Melia is requesting a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase meat, tortillas, soft drinks, water, and other products to prepare her food, so that she can offer her customers variety and fullfill all their orders.

Melia's plans are to continue working on her business, strengthen it, and attract more customers, in order to improve her income.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase meat, tortillas, soft drinks, water, and other products for her business

loans.name: Dunia Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Dunia, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos y a su esposo en el municipio de Langue, al sur de Honduras
La señora Dunia se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y abarrotería en general como ser maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, café, refrescos, harina, margarina, pan, agua, medicinas de uso popular, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Dunia tiene su negocio ubicado a 200 metros de la estación de buses de su pueblo, un lugar de bastante trancito de personas.
Dunia esta solicitando su crédito de 10,000.00 Lempiras para la compra de maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, café, refrescos, harina, margarina, pan, agua, y otros productos para abastecer mas el negocio y de esta forma tener variedad de productos y que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos al encontrar variedad de productos.
Los planes de Dunia  son seguir siempre con su negocio, tratar de fortalecerlo más y lograr acaparar más clientes, para de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor vida a su familia.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Dunia is 29 years old, is married, and has two children. She lives together with them and her husband in the municipality of Langue, in southern Honduras.

Dunia makes a living selling bulk grains and groceries in general, such as, corn, rice, beans, sugar, lard, coffee, sodas, flour, margarine, bread, water, general use medicines, meats, dairy products, sausages, etc. Dunia's business is located 200 meters from her town's bus station, a place with quite a lot of people passing by.

Dunia is requesting a loan of 10,000.00 Lempiras to purchase corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, coffee, sodas, flour, margarine, bread, water, and other products to further supply the business and therefore have a variety of products so that her customers will feel satisfied when finding this variety of products.

Dunia's plans are to always go on with her business, try to make it stronger and manage to get more customers, in order to be able to improve her income and provide a better standard of living for her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, beans, sugar, butter, coffee, sodas, flour, margarine, bread, water and other products for her business

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es:
Beatriz es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo de 14 años a quien su padre abandonó hace un largo tiempo sin hacer ninguna contribución económica para su sostenimiento. Beatriz siempre ha tenido un empleo con el cual genera ingresos para su sostenimiento, sin embargo, su salario no es suficiente para poder sostener todos los gastos que se generan en su hogar, y fue por esto que decidió montar un negocio paralelo a su empleo con el cual pudiera generar ingresos extras para poder así ofrecer a su hijo todas las necesidades cubiertas. Beatriz comenzó vendiendo prendas de vestir a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos, y su negocio fue creciendo poco a poco gracias al buen servicio que ofrecía. Actualmente, Beatriz ofrece a sus clientes diferentes productos de uso personal como prendas de vestir, electrodomésticos, entre otros. Debido al gran crecimiento que han tenido sus ventas en su negocio paralelo a su empleo, Beatriz busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como prendas de vestir y electrodomésticos para así responder a los grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera, Beatriz espera que su negocio paralelo a su empleo siga creciendo y le siga generando ingresos adicionales para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Además, Beatriz espera que con mayores ingresos le pueda ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a single mother, head of household; she has a 14 year old son who was abandoned by his father a long time ago without having contributed anything toward his support.  Beatriz has always had a job that generates income for her support.  However, her salary isn’t sufficient to cover all the expenses her household has and this is why she decided to set up a business to generate extra income to be able to cover all her son's needs.

Beatriz started out selling clothes to family members, neighbors and friends and her business started to grow little by little thanks to the good service she offered.  Currently, Beatriz offers her customers various personal use items like clothes and home appliances, among others.  Due to the great growth her sales have had, Beatriz is looking for a loan so that she can buy personal use items like clothes and home appliances to respond to large pending orders she has from customers. 

In this way, Beatriz hopes that her business will continue to grow and generate the necessary income to support her home.  Also, Beatriz hopes that if her business generates higher income she will be able to offer her son a better quality of life and access to a better education.

loans.use: to buy clothes and home appliances.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad, y vive junto a una de ella, en la en el municipio de Langue, al sur de Honduras.
La señora Mercedes se dedica a la venta de hamacas y lazos en el mercado municipal de Langue, el cual ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad, ya que a ella le compran sus productos clientes del interior del país así como del extranjero.
Doña Mercedes esta solicitando su crédito de 10,000.00 Lempiras para la compra de Hamacas y Lazos para surtir mas el negocio y de esta forma tener variedad de productos y que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de poder encontrar calidad en los productos.
Los planes de doña Mercedes  es construir un local dentro del mercado de Langue para establecer un punto estratégico de ventas y así mejorar su clientela.
Doña Mercedes sueña con tener un negocio fuerte para ayudar a sus hijas y que sus vidas sean en mejores condiciones.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Mercedes is 49 years old and is single. She has two adult daughters, and lives with one of them in the municipality of Langue in the south of Honduras.

Mercedes makes a living selling hammocks and rope in Langue's municipal market. For several years, she has worked in this business and her products are bought by customers in the country as well as foreigners.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 10,000.00 Lempiras to purchase hammocks and rope to better supply the business, to have a larger variety of products and to make her costumers feel happy to find quality products.

Mercedes's plan is to build a store in Langue's market and as a result have a strategic sales point to increase her customer base. Mercedes dreams about having a strong business to help her daughters and make their lives better.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 201

loans.use: to purchase hammocks and rope for her business

loans.name: Teonila Maria

texts.es: Teonila de 47 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil). el decidió ponerse un negocio de papelería debido a   que tenia que cuidar a sus hijos. Aparte ella tiene un mini bazar en el cual le va bien. Con ganas decidió ponerse una papelería. Trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas . a futuro ella desea darle una mejor vida a sus hijas junto con el esposo. Con el préstamo comprara (cuadernos, plumas, bebidas)
texts.en:
Teonila is 47 years old and lives in a suburban section of Guayaquil.  She decided to open a stationery business because she had to take care of her children.  In addition, she has a mini-bazaar that is also doing well.  With the earnings from this business, she decided to open a stationery shop.  Teonila works every day with great effort.  In the future, she and her husband want to provide a better life for their daughters.  

With this loan, Teonila will buy notebooks, pens, and beverages.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and beverages.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena educación. Debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, amparo decidió montar su propio negocio el cual es un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas que saca a media cuadra de su casa. Trabaja todos los días y cuando tiene la oportunidad una hija le colabora con la atención del negocio. Gracias a este negocio, su familia ha podido tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progresar económicamente. Con el ánimo de seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes, Amparo busca un préstamo que le permita comprar insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas.

De esta manera Amparo seguirá atendiendo su negocio y tendrá la posibilidad de seguir ofreciendo a su familia una buena calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Amparo is married and has 2 children who she has always wanted to provide with a good education.  Because the income which her husband makes is not sufficient to cover the household expenses, Amparo decided to open her own business, which is a fast food stall located a half a block from her home.  She works every day, and whenever she has time, one daughter helps to mind the business.  Thanks to this business, her family has been able to attain a better quality of life and greater opportunities for economic progress.

With the aim of continuing to offer good products to her customers, Amparo is seeking a loan which would permit her to buy the ingredients she need to prepare her food.  In this way, Amparo will be able to continue minding her business and will have the opportunity to continue offering her family a good quality of life and greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients required for the preparation of her dishes.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Doña Beatriz, es soltera, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 1 hija  y vive junto a ella en su propia casa de habitación  en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Doña Beatriz es la venta de tortillas por mayor, ya que tiene clientes preferenciales de algunos restaurantes y empresas de Nacaome en la zona sur de Honduras. Doña Beatriz esta solicitando la cantidad de 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de una maquina para fabricar tortillas para  que sea mayor y mejor la producción de tortillas  para su negocio, de esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio y hacer menor esfuerzo en la preparación de sus tortillas.
Doña Beatriz entre sus sueños a futuro esta la idea de hacerle mejoras a su vivienda ya que aun necesita realizarle algunos cambios.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Beatriz is single, is 44 years old, and has one daughter who she lives with in her own home in the Valle department in southern Honduras.  Beatriz's business is in sales of tortillas in bulk, and she already has regular customers from some restaurants and shops in Nacaome in the south of Honduras.  

Beatriz is requesting a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to buy a machine to make tortillas in hopes of expanding and improving the production of tortillas for her business.  This way, she will generate more sales in her business and it will be less work to make her tortillas.

One of Beatriz's dreams for the future is to make improvements to her house, where she still needs to make a few changes.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy a machine to make tortillas for her business.

loans.name: Enertesina

texts.es: Enertesina de 51 años vive  ( suburbio ecuador ). Ella deccidio escoger este negocio de tener una tienda para mejorar su situación económica y para ayudar a los vecinos que vallan a comprar tan lejos a parte su esposo vende encebollados por la mañana.  Trabaja todos los días sola . a futuro ella anhela tener bien su negocio y darle una buena vida a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( colas arroz ect).
texts.en:
Enertesina, 51, lives in Suburbio, Ecuador.  She decided to chose this business of having a store to improve her economic situation and to help her neighbors who go so far to shop.  She works alone every day.  In addition, her husband sells "encebollados" [fish stew made with onions] in the morning.  In the future she wants to have her business doing well and give her children a good life.

With the loan she will buy soda, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos en su casa ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle  al sur de Honduras, dedicándose por mas de 20 años a la elaboración y venta de pan, rosquillas, quesadillas y pasteles de piña, su venta es ambulante viaja desde su comunidad todo los días de lunes a sábado al mercado de San Lorenzo a vender sus productos.
Doña Alba esta solicitando 10,000.00 para compra  de leña, maíz, azúcar, compra de latas, y la reparación de la galera donde cocina el pan, con la inversión del préstamo pretende salir adelante en su negocio ya que esta muy contenta porque a través de estos prestamos esta comprando los materiales para hacer su propia casa ya que durante toda su vida a rentando con su familia.
Doña Alba sueña que para los próximos años pueda hacer su propia casa y que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde vivir.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Alba is 43 years old and a single mother. She lives with her three children in their house located in a small village of San Lorenzo, Valle in southern Honduras. She has worked for more than 20 years producing and selling bread, donuts, quesadillas, and pineapple cakes. She travels from her community every day Monday through Saturday to the market in San Lorenzo to sell her products. 

Alba is requesting 10,000.00 HNL to buy wood, corn, sugar, cans, and to cover the repairs of the area where she bakes the bread. With the investment from the loan she aspires to move forward with her business. She is already very happy because with these loans she is buying material to build her own house, as she has rented with her family for her entire life. Alba hopes that in the coming years she will be able to build her own house and that her children will have a place to live. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to purchase wood, corn, sugar, cans, and to cover the repairs of the area where she cooks the bread for her business.

loans.name: Maria Engracia

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 52 años, esta casada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en  el municipio de Langue al, sur de Honduras.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de verduras como ser papas, zanahorias, Yuca, repollo, mínimo verde, cebolla, chile dulce, dulce, plátanos, brócoli, patates, remolacha, tajadas, tacos, frescos naturales, yuca frita, queso, mariscos, etc. ella esta solicitando su crédito de 5,000.00 a para la compra de papas, zanahorias, Yuca, repollo, mínimo verde, cebolla, chile dulce, dulce, plátanos, brócoli, patates, remolacha, tajadas, tacos, frescos naturales, yuca frita y queso para elaborar golosinas y refrescos.
Los planes de Doña María  son seguir siempre con su negocio, tratar de fortalecerlo mas y lograr acaparar mas clientes, para de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña María desea gozar de buena salud para sacar adelante a su familia con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
María, is 52 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three children in the Langue municipality in the south of Honduras.

María makes a living selling vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cassavas, cabbages, green bananas, onions, bell peppers, bananas, broccoli, sweet potatoes, beets, fried plantains, tacos, natural refreshments, fried cassavas, cheese, seafood, etc. 

She is requesting a 5,000.00 HNL loan to buy potatoes, carrots, cassavas, cabbages, green bananas, onions, bell peppers, bananas, broccoli, sweet potatoes, beets, fried plantains, tacos, natural refreshments, fried cassavas and cheese to prepare snacks and refreshments.

María's plans are to continue with her business, to strengthen it and as a result gain more clients, thus improving her income. María hopes for good health to be able to get her family ahead with her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, cassavas, cabbages, green bananas, onions, bell peppers, bananas, broccoli, sweet potatoes, beets, fired plantains, tacos, natural refreshments, fried cassavas and cheese to prepare sweets and refreshments.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Yambio.  She has a food stall, and has been in business for one year.  She is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of them are still in school 

Grace heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice lives in Yambio. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children -- all of them are still in school. 

Unice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Yambio.  She is 30 years old and married.  She has five children who all attend school.  She sells charcoal and has been in business for five years.

Gloria heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal.  She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jese Rolando

texts.es: Jose Rolando. de 35 años de edad y nos cuenta que desde muy pequeño empeso a trabajar para poder salir adelante el juntamente con su otro hermano venden saldalias,el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de sandalias el vende junto con su hermano y la venta que aparese en frente es las de su hermano y la de el al lado ya que se dedican a esta actividad desde hace 6 años,nos cuenta que ahora que entra el verano es cuando mas se vende su producto es por eso que nececita surtir su negocio porque es cuando las personas salen a pasear a la playa,entonces logra vender. Espera que kiva le pueda ayudar para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: José Rolando, 35, tells us that he started working when still very young to be able to get ahead. Together with his brother he's sells sandals. Rose is requesting this loan to purchase and sell sandals with his brother. He is standing in his brother's stall [in the photo], and his shop is the one next door. They’ve been in this business for six years and tell us that when summer starts is when Jose sells the most of this product and this is why he needs to stock his business so that when people pass by on the way to the beach he can attain sales.  He hopes that Kiva will be able to help him stay in business.

loans.use: to buy sandals to sell.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Agée de 36ans, Cécile est mariée et a à charge quatre enfants, elle a sa boutique à domicile et y vend des vivres. En vue d'améliorer son chiffre d'affaire elle a fait recours  à l'appui de Finadev  afin d'atteindre ses objectifs et satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Cécile is 36 years old, married, and has four children in her care. She runs a shop from her home where she sells food supplies. She has sought the support of Finadey in order to improve her sales, reach her goals, and satisfy the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of corn, 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of manioc flour

loans.name: Maryorie Yadira

texts.es: Maryorie de 38 años vive ( libertad ecuador ). Ella es profesora por lo cual ella esta al tanto de la demanda que en las escuelas  no se puede vender . poe ese motivo ella decidió también entrar al negocio de confeccionar uniformes . le va bien trabaja todos los días junto a su  mama. Es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo. A futuro ella anhela tener un buen negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( telas  )
texts.en: Maryorie is 38 years old and she lives in Libertad, Ecuador. Being a teacher, she is aware of the demand that exists in the schools, but as she cannot sell there, she has decided to start another activity producing school uniforms when off work. Things are going well, and she works every day with her mother. She is a single mother and she has 1 child. In the future she wants to run a good activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Edwin Andres

texts.es:
Edwin es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer el mejor servicio posible en su negocio. Edwin tiene un negocio de venta de pollos asados, el cual es conocido por la buena atención que ofrecen y la calidad de sus productos. Con este negocio Edwin genera los ingresos para su familia, por lo que trabaja fuertemente en el para sacarlo adelante y hacer que crezca cada vez más. Su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, y esto hace que aún le hagan falta algunos implementos, por lo que busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una campana de extracción y una fritadora para terminar el montaje de su negocio.

De esta manera, Edwin podrá preparar sus productos con mejores prácticas y así podrá incrementar su capacidad para atender el mercado. Además, espera que su negocio siga creciendo para generar ingresos con los cuales su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is a very hard working person who has always been noted for offering the best possible service at his business. Edwin has a business selling roasted chicken, which is well known for the good attention offered and the quality of its products.

Edwin generates his family's income with this business, that's why he works hard to keep it going and make it grow more and more. His business was set up with a very small amount of capital, and because of this it still lacks some equipment. This is why he is requesting a loan that will give him the possibility of being able to purchase an extractor hood and a fryer in order to finish the set up of his business. 

With this, Edwin will be better suited to prepare his products and this will allow him to increase his capacity to serve the market. He also hopes his business will continue growing and generate more income to allow his family to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase an extractor hood and a fryer to finish the set up of his store

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Doeurn, is 43 years old. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and two daughters. One is married, two attend school and one assists his parents with the business. 

Sokhan and her husband produce and sell fertilizer. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry fertilizer for sale. She will also use part of the loan to buy materials needed for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry fertilizer for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is photographed inside his store. He is a 22-year-old single man. For the past three years, Ahmad has been running a store selling household electrical goods, which has been a profitable project and his only source of income.

Ahmad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a selection of different types of home electrical goods that are much in demand with customers because of their affordable price. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income.

loans.use: To purchase a selection of  household electrical goods for sale

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in their house.

Yasmeen is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother with one son. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs and pay for purchasing new home furniture.

Yasmeen is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as living room and bedroom furniture. Taking this loan will offer to Yasmeen and her family suitable and comfortable furniture to enjoy their living at home.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is photographed in his store for selling home appliances. Naji is a 22-year-old single young man. For 4 years he has been operating a store that sells home appliances to customers, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Naji wants to expand the size of the store and purchase a collection of home appliances for sale, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover these costs. Taking this loan will improve the store's condition through having a larger space and enable Naji to have more stock to sell. This will increase sales and improve Naji's income.

loans.use: to expand the size of the store and purchase a collection of home appliances for sale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is photographed next to the bedroom furniture he will purchase. He is a 23 -year-old single young man, employed, but his salary is low and not enough to cover all of his life costs.

Mohammad wants to purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats for his house. He is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him to cover the costs of these purchases. Taking this loan will enable Mohammad to have suitable furniture and enjoy living at home.

loans.use: to purchase new bedroom furniture and living room seats.

loans.name: Yelitza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yelitza es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 3 hijos, y hace aproximadamente 31 años tiene un salón de belleza con el que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Yelitza aprendió la actividad desde muy temprana edad y esto le ha permitido tener una gran experiencia que le permite ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio en su salón de belleza. Debido a que el negocio ya lleva un largo tiempo funcionando y también un largo tiempo sin hacer algunas remodelaciones, Yelitza busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una silla para su salón de belleza e insumos para llevar a cabo su actividad.

De esta manera, Yelitza podrá seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio y seguir teniendo la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Además, Yelitza espera que este negocio le brinde la oportunidad de ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Yelitza is a single mother and the head of a family of three children. For approximately 31 years she has had a beauty salon that has allowed her to get her family ahead.

Yelitza learned the business from an early age and this has allowed her to have a great experience, which allows her to offer better service to the clients of her beauty salon.

Since the business has been running for a long time and also a long time without doing some renovations, Yelitza is asking for a loan, which will give her the opportunity to purchase a chair for her beauty salon and supplies to carry out her business. In this way, Yelitza could continue offering her clients good service and continue to have the source of income for the support of her children. Moreover, Yelitza hopes that her business will give her the opportunity to give her children a good quality of life and greater economic opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a chair for her beauty salon and supplies to carry out her business

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en: Chamreun is 41 years old and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a widow with three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are monks, one is a garment worker, another one attends school, and another one is still young. Chamreun is a scarf weaver. She is requesting her first loan of $1000 to purchase cotton threads for her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To change from wooden stilts to cement concreted stilts.

loans.name: Sokkal’S Group

texts.en:
Sokkal was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including her. All the group's members live on an island off of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

1-Sokkal, age 52, is a weaver. She is a widow with three children--two sons and one daughter. One is a designer and two are in school. She is requesting a loan of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business. 

2-Sophea, age 39, is a weaver and her husband is a soldier. She has three children--one son and two daughters. One is married and lives separately and the others attend school. Sophea is requesting a loan of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business. 

3-Ny, age 60, is a weaver. She is a widow with one son and two daughters. One is a security guard, another one is a garment worker and another one is a housekeeper. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.  

Photo: Sokkal is on the left, Ny is in the middle and Sophea is on the right.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Soheng

texts.en:
Soheng (in photo) is 41 years old, and her husband, Ang, is 44 years old.  They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have one son and two daughters. One of their children is a garment worker and the others are in school.   

Soheng is a rice farmer. Her husband is a taxi driver, and he assists her with the farming business when he is free. Soheng is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Atem

texts.en:
Atem lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 20 years old and married with no child. 

Atem heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Colette Chantal

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Colette Chantal  est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés . Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des divers et fait  en plus de la poissonnerie, avec une expérience de 06 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Elle aimerait accroître son stock et maximiser son profit pour le bonheur de la famille.
texts.en:
Colette Chantal is 43 years old, married, and mother of three children, all of whom have had schooling.

She has six years of experience running a shop where she sells a variety of items, and selling fish as well. She stocks up at one of the local markets.

She would like to increase her supply and maximize her profit for the happiness of her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of spaghetti, 1 carton of milk, 1 box of fish, 1 box of meat

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Sami, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Randa is a 28-year-old, married woman. She is a mother with two sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed but earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs and to pay the cost of completing the building of their house.

Randa is requesting a $3,000 loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of completing the building of their house, including installing tiles, windows and doors, and painting. 

With this loan, Randa and her family will soon be able to live in their house and enjoy suitable living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the cost of completing the building of their house.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman lives in Bor. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are still in school. 

She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for three years.  Aman heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Hadhood

texts.en:
Hadhood is photographed in the store he has for selling mobile phones and their accessories.

Hadhood is a twenty-four-year-old single young man. A year ago, he opened a store selling mobile phones and their accessories. This is a profitable project and his only source of income.

Hadhood wants to expand the size of his business, since his store is located in an area with a lot of movement and has a strong demand from customers for mobiles. He is therefore requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing mobile phones and their accessories. This will increase sales and improve Hadhood's income.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She runs a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 years old, and married with three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and milk. She will use the extra income generated by this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is photographed next to his house.

Jameel is a twenty-eight-year-old young man, he is married with no children yet. He is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Jameel is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of finishing his house and improving its condition. He needs to do things such as installing windows, installing electric extensions and painting. This will enable Jameel and his wife to move in soon and to live in suitable housing conditions.

loans.use: To complete work on his house.

loans.name: Athieng

texts.en:
Athieng lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Athieng heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos de 47 años vive ( guasmo Guayaquil ). Desde muy pequeño le gustaba trabajar por el bien de su familia . el tiene un restaurante donde vende almuersos y comida rápida . le ba bien trabaja con su esposa tiene un hijo . a futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( mesa sillas ).
texts.en: Carlos, 47, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil.  Since he was very little he’s liked to work for his family’s wellbeing.  He has a restaurant where he sells lunches and fast food.  He does well in his work.  He works together with his wife and he has a son.  In the future he’d like to fix up the restaurant.  He will use the loan to buy tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en:
Nabeel is a 30-year-old young married man.  He is a father of two sons and one daughter.  He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his family's needs and expenses.

For the past two years, Nabeel has also been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project.

Nabeel is requesting a USD 1,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses of licensing and insuring his taxi. This will allow Nabeel to move from one place to another freely, since his taxi will become legal.  This will enable Nabeel to work extra hours and increase his family's income.

Nabeel is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: pay to license and insure his taxi

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.  He is pictured next to the rickshaw he will purchase.

Ahlam is a 27-year-old young married woman.  She is a mother of two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is employed with a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's costs and needs.

Ahlam is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a rickshaw. This will offer to Ahlam's husband another work that will help in improving the family's income. 

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is considerable with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 22-year-old young single man.  For the past three years, Yousef has been opening a barber shop, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him.

Yousef wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing a new barber kit, so he is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs. Taking this loan will improve the quality of Yousef's work and attract new customers to the barber shop, which will lead to an increase in Yousef's income.

Yousef is photographed in his barber shop while he is cutting hair for one of his customers.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: purchase a barber kit

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en:
Mahran is a 29 year-old married man, he is a father of four sons and two daughters.
For the past two years, Mahran has been operating a workshop for fixing washing machines for customers, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all the costs.

Mahran is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new repair kit that will be used to fix washing machines; it will also purchase a number of washing machine spare parts and engines. This will give Mahran the necessary kit and tools to continue his work, which will improve the family's income positively, especially since it is the only source of income to them.
Mahran is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new repair kit, engines and spare parts to fix washing machines.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor lives in Bor. She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three children. Two of her children are still in school. 

Ayor first heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 SDG in order to purchase sugar and milk. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of the children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three sons and three daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 
Ibtesam wants to help her husband in improving the family's income by raising sheep and selling their products, which will be a profitable project.

Ibtesam is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a number of sheep to raise and in improving the herd's condition. This will enable Ibtesam to start her project and sell sheep products to customers which will lead to the improvement of the family's income.

Ibtesam is photographed in front of the sheep's area.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and improve the herd's condition

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 28-year-old young man. He is employed in a local factory and earns a salary, but not enough to cover all the costs. He is engaged and is preparing his house to get married soon.

Hiatham is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of completing the finishing of his house and improving its condition, such as installing tiles, installing windows and doors, and painting.

Taking this loan will allow Haitham to prepare his house well and get married soon, and then to live in a house in suitable condition with his wife. Haitham is photographed next to his house.

loans.use: To complete finishing the house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old young married man and he is a father of one daughter. For the past ten years, he has been operating a workshop for repairing vehicles, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all the costs.

He wants to renew the repairing kit he has, so he is requesting a 2,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new vehicle repairing kit. This will improve the quality of his work, especially that his workshop has loyal customers and enjoys a good reputation among them. This will lead to an increase in the amount of work and improve the family's income.

Ahmad is photographed in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase necessary vehicle repairing kit

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old young man. He is married with no children yet. For the past five years, he has been operating a store for selling all types of shoes, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover all costs.

Ahmad is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer season shoes to sell upon customers' requests. This will enable him to compete with others well, and this will lead to increased sales and improve his income.

Ahmad is photographed next to his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer season shoes to sell.

loans.name: Qussai

texts.en:
Qussai is photographed in the shed, next to the sheep he is raising.

Qussai is a 27-year-old young single man. His mother is a school employee who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all their expenses.

For the past year, Qussai has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project and a way to share with his mother the family's expenses and cover their needs.

Qussai is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and expand and improve the herd's condition

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal, photographed inside one of the stores that sells home appliances, is a 29-year-old employed man who earns a low salary insufficient to cover all of his costs. Currently engaged to be married soon, Nidal is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary home appliances such as a stove, washing machine, and refrigerator. This loan will enable him to prepare well for the occasion and offer to his betrothed a suitably-furnished house

loans.use: to purchase home appliances in preparation for his marriage.

loans.name: Shukri

texts.en:
Shukri is a 24-year-old young man. He is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the costs for his wedding preparations. 

Shukri is engaged and is preparing himself to get married soon, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary home appliances such as a stove, washing machine, and refrigerator. Taking this loan will enable Shukri to prepare well for his wedding and offer to his house suitable and necessary home appliances.

Shukri is photographed inside one of the stores that sells home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase necessary home appliances to prepare his house for his wedding.

loans.name: Ede Manuel

texts.es:
Ede Manuel tiene una fábrica de piezas dentales desde hace un largo tiempo, la cual inició su padre y trabajaba con el desde muy temprana edad. Cuando su padre murió, quedó a cargo de esta y ahora es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años de edad. En su fábrica, ha trabajado fuertemente con el ánimo de poderla sacar adelante y seguir teniéndola como su fuente de ingresos para ofrecer en su hogar una buena calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica. Gracias a que últimamente ha logrado tener muy buenas ventas, Ede Manuel busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar la materia prima que requiere para la fabricación de sus piezas dentales y poder responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y podrá seguir teniendo unos ingresos estables para su familia. Ede Manuel sueña con que su negocio les permita progresar económicamente y poder comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
For a long time Ede Manuel has had a dental parts factory, which his father began. From a very early age, Ede Manuel started working with his father. When his father died, he was left in charge of the business, which now is his source of income to support his home, where he lives with his wife and his 3-year-old daughter. 

At his factory, he has worked hard with the intention to keep and grow the business that is the source of income to provide his family a good quality of life and economic stability. 

Thanks to the fact that he has had very good sales lately, Ede Manuel is asking for a loan, which will give him the opportunity to buy the raw material that he needs for the manufacture of dental pieces needed to fill his customers' big orders.

In this way, his business will continue to grow and give him a stable income source for his family. Ede Manuel dreams that his business will allow them to progress economically and to buy their own home.

loans.use: to buy the raw material that he needs for the manufacture of dental pieces needed to fill his customers' big orders.

loans.name: Izzeddeen

texts.en:
Izzeddeen, shown here in his barber shop, is a 26-year-old single man. For the past two years, Izzeddeen has been operating a barber shop. It has been a successful project, but the business does not generate quite enough income to cover all the costs.

Izzeddeen is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber kit and improving the shop's condition. He intends to use the loan for things like painting the shop and installing new shelves and mirrors. Taking this loan will help him create a new image for his barber shop, which will attract recent and new customers. The new kit will also provide added value and quality to his work, which will lead to an increase in Izzeddeen's income.

loans.use: to improve the condition of his shop and purchase a new barber kit.

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en:
Yaqoub is photographed with the old kit he uses to install air conditioning.

Yaqoub is a Palestinian and married with two sons and four daughters. For the past seven years, Yaqoub has been earning an income installing air conditioning, but is not covering all of his costs. Yaqoub is requesting a USD 3,000 loan from FATEN to help him purchase a new kit for installing air conditioning that would include different types of drills and screws, filters, and special materials to clean air conditioners. This would increase the quality of Yaqoub's work and increase his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new kit for installing air conditioning.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani, 22, lives in Pshatavan village with her husband, two children, and in-laws. The family's main income comes from farming. They have established a grape vineyard. To develop more profitable agriculture, Ani has decided to start breeding cattle. This loan would enable her to purchase three cows and implement her plan. 
Ani expects to increase her income, which she plans to invest in farming. In particular, she wants to purchase stakes for the grape vineyard.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Oeung is a hard-working mother from Batey district, Kompong Cham province who helps her husband manage a rice farming business. She is 25 years old and has four young kids who completely depend on the family’s income. She has a commitment to provide her children's education through learning in public schools. 

Oeung has been in the business for more than 10 years. This business has existed since her ancestors' generation and it was handed down continually to her at the present. This coming season, Oeung will grows dry season rice and potatoes. In order to ensure a high production, Oeung would like to take out a loan to pay for the whole process of farming operating expenses. She hopes to obtain a good harvest and increase more income in the following months.

loans.use: to pay for the whole process of farming operating expenses.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung is a 31-year-old married woman. She owns and manages a convenient shop in her village, Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham province, Cambodia, while her husband manages the maintenance of a rice field to provide income and educate their only child. She has been doing this business for more than 13 years and is able to earn an average of $1.50 per day.

To make a good progress in rice farming, Soung would like to borrow a loan through HKL to purchase a plowing machine to support her husband's business. It'll enable him to maintain good productivity. Through this loan, she hopes that she will improve her family's owned business and will be successful in the businesses. She plans to enlarge her shop when she has enough funds for that.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 37-year-old business woman. She operates a grocery store for her neighboring area. She has been in this business for over 6 years. She makes good sales every month, which helps her manage the household expenses along with her husband. 
Her husband is involved in a vegetable sales business. He buys vegetables from vegetable markets at cheap rates and sells to other vegetable shop owners for a profit. He goes out to work in the morning. Although his work requires time, he does it with full dedication. He loves dealing with people and has an interest in it. He also makes good sales from his business. 
Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her grocery store business. She will invest the loan in buying groceries in larger quantities to sell in her store. She is hopeful that her business will be improved a lot after investing the loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 34 years old, and married with four children, three sons and one daughter. Three of the children are still in school. Her eldest son is no longer in school.
  
Razia's husband has a private job with a monthly wage. His income is not sufficient to meet the financial expenses of the family, so Razia helps him by running a canteen business. She can also sew, which she does at weekends.   

Razia runs a canteen in a school, where she serves children food including cold drinks, samosas, chips and kababs. She earns good money from her business. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah, which she plans to invest in buying supplies like cold drinks, cooking oil, spices, flour and potatoes for her canteen business. Razia hopes that her business will grow after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy food for her canteen business

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar is a 37-year-old married woman involved in a sewing and embroidery business. Her work is home based. She receives orders from neighboring areas and is paid after she fulfills the orders on time. She is an expert in her work. Her clients are satisfied and give her regular orders.

She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her youngest son has a laundry business and financially supports the family. Parveen’s husband has a private job and is paid monthly.

Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business. She will use the loan to buy an embroidery machine so she will be able to receive more embroidery orders and increase her earnings. She is hopeful this investment will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Duo Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: Duo Manantial de Vida. Este duo esta integrado por la señora Clediberta,Ella tiene 49 años de edad tiene un hijo,se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica de forma ambulante desde hace 5 años,nos comenta que el proposito de ella es tener un lugar donde vender su productos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica espera que fape le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Duo Manantial de Vida. 

Clediberta is part of this duo. She is 49 years old and has one child. She makes a living selling traditional clothing street-side for five years. She tells us that her goal is to have a place to sell her products. 

She is applying for this loan to purchase traditional clothing. She hopes FAPE can help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing

loans.name: Duo Sara Y Alma Group

texts.es:
Duo Sara y Alma.
Este duo esta integrado por la señora Lilian es una persona muy trabajadora y eficiente con muchos sueñor es madre que vive cola con sus dos hijos,ella se dedica a la venta de pollos y tambien a la venta de tamales,y leña,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pollos y insumos para elavorar tamales y tambien para la compra de leña ya que por esta epoca la leña se encuentra a buen precio,espera que kiva le puede ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Duo Sara and Alma

Lilian is a member of this duo.  She is a very hardworking and efficient with a lot of dreams. She is a mother and she lives with her two children.  

She works selling chickens, tamales and firewood.  Because of this, she is requesting this loan to buy chickens, ingredients to make tamales, and also to buy firewood which can be found at a good price this time of year.  She hopes that Kiva will be able to help her with the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, materials to make tamales and firewood.

loans.name: Duo Luchando Por La Vicion Group

texts.es: DUO LUCHANDO POR LA VISION, QUIEN ES EL SEÑOR PEDRO ELIAS LA CUAL SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE CAMISAS PARA NIÑOS Y ADULTOS, DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS.  NOS CUENTA QUE SIGUE LUCHANDO PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU PEQUEÑA FABRICA, LOS CLIENTES TAMBIEN LO HAN AYUDADO YA QUE LE HACEN VARIOS PEDIDOS Y DE ESA FORMA EL HA SUPERADO SUS VENTAS.  NOS CUENTA QUE LA TELA YA NO LE ES SUFICIENTE, POR TAL MOTIVO NECESITA COMPRAR MAS POR ELLO SOLICITA UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE TELA Y CONFECCIONAR SUS PRENDAS. SU SUEÑO ES LLEGAR A SER UNA EMPRESA DISTRIBUIDORA DEL PUEBLO.
texts.en:
Duo Luchando por la Visión 

Pedro Elias has made a living by sewing shirts for children and adults for many years.  He says he keeps on working to get ahead with his little shop, and that his customers have also aided him by making various orders and this is how he has increased his sales.  

He says the fabric he has is no longer enough, and this is why he needs to buy more.  Therefore, he is asking for a new loan to buy fabric and produce his garments.  His dream is to become a distribution center for the town.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shirts.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie hardworking and very loving mother of two grown-up children. She manages a store where she sells different products to the community. Rosemarie is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional products that she can sell to the people of the community. Rosemarie hopes that her store will be renovated someday so that it will be more convenient for her customers.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, coffee, sugar and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Fozia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Fozia Parveen is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children with her husband: two daughters and one son. All of her children are getting an education. She focuses on her children’s education so that they may have a bright future.  Fozia is also an educated lady; she completed studies through the 10th standard, however she was not able to continue her studies due to the poor financial condition of her family. 

She owns and operates a home-based embroidery business. She embroiders clothes by order and earns well after completing her orders on time. She is an expert in embroidery and crafts beautiful designs on clothes which help to attract more customers.
 
Her husband is a professional driver. He drives his own rickshaw and assists his passengers by dropping them off at their destinations.

Fozia has requested a loan from Asasah, a Kiva partner, for her embroidery business. She will use the loan to purchase clothes, beads and colored thread in a larger quantity so that she may acquire larger orders and increase her income. 

She is hopeful that as a result of this loan and investment, she will bring positive financial changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy material and clothes for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es: JUAN   de 44 años vive (Quevedo  Ecuador). El comenzó trabajando  en MECANICA PERO A RAIZ QUE SE LICIO la columna opto ´por trabajar de taxista. Hasta ahora le va bien la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. Trabaja todos los días solo. Es casado tiene 4 hijos a futuro el anhela tener su casa . con el préstamo comprar ( materiales auto ).
texts.en:
Juan, 44, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He began working in auto mechanics but, because he damaged his spine, he opted to work as a taxi driver.  Up to now it is going well for him.  The difficulty he faces is crime.  He works alone every day.  He is married and has two children.  In the future he wants to have a house.

With the loan he will buy auto supplies.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Rachoquel Group

texts.es:
La señora  es casada tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3  de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a lo oficios domésticos y al comercio, a la venta de artículos de plástico,  inicio este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para ampliar su negocio en la compra de: canastas, vasos, platos, termos, etc. ya que espera tener un negocio mejor y surtido. Las demás integrantes se dedican a a la venta de trastos, venta de plásticos, venta de ropa, calzado, y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
This woman is married and 30 years old. She completed 3 years of primary schooling and has 4 children, 3 of whom are still in school. She is a homemaker and also has a business selling plastic products. She began this business with very little money and now has 10 years of experience. She relies on the support of her husband, who does the same work.

She is organizing a group to request a loan that will be used to expand her business through the purchase of baskets, cups, plates, thermoses, etc., since she hopes to have a better and more well-stocked business. The other group members sell used items, plastic products, clothing, footwear, and work raising animals.

loans.use: to buy plastic products and market them.

loans.name: Ramzy

texts.en:
Ramzy is 30 years old; he is married and has two children and is a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He mentions that he has been involved in selling cosmetics and perfumes for two years. His parents taught him how to develop in this business.The location where he sells his products is in a market in Sana`a.  There is a lot of activity in his area as far as all types of arts and crafts are concerned. Because of his good customer skills, he is able to attract more clients.

His wife, children and parents make up his immediate family. He would like to expand his business. So he took out a youth loan of 80,000 YER to stock his business with cosmetics, ladies' handbags and perfumes. He wishes to enroll his children in private schools.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, ladies' handbags and perfumes for his business.

loans.name: Razia Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Razia sultana is 32 years old. She owns and operates a pranda-making business. Prandas are ornaments used to tie back hair. She makes beautiful looking prandas for her customers and earns income.  
She is the mother of five children (two daughters and three sons). All of her children are young. 
Razia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy material such as thread, beads, and colorful ribbons in larger quantities to prepare better quality and better looking prandas for sale. 
She is confident about the further expansion of her pranda-making business after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy material for a pranda-making business

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen is 51 years old. She is married and has seven children, four are married and three are single.  She owns and operates a business from her house, which is located in Baray district, Kompong Tom province.  She sells a variety of merchandise like packaged noodles, canned food, groceries, beverages, biscuits and other similar things.  She is friendly and builds good relationships with her customers, which is why they prefer to use her products.  She typically earns around $2 per day from this business, while her husband works in the rice field to provide enough income to sustain the family. 

Pen would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy stock of merchandise such as biscuits, shampoos, personal care products and home use product to refill her shop. With this loan, Pen will be able to sustain and further improve her business.  With the remaining funds, Pen will pay for harvesting fees to support her husband's business.

Pen hopes that through her determination and effort, she can lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en:
